display: inline-block; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_70TN\">\n</span></span><br />\n</span><br />\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_70TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_72b+seedBDw_D\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_70B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c636942327570551946\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_70M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/01/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_15.html?showComment=1516044653505#c636942327570551946\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">January 16, 2018 at 1:00 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_70MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">AT THE FIRST COUNCIL OF NICEA THEY AGREED THAT COOKED UP JESUS WOULD HAVE A SURNAME CHRIST ( NAMED AFTER KRISHNA )\u2014SINCE ROME HAD ALREADY USURPED RAMA.</span></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"></span><br />\n<div style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">BUT THEN THEY WANTED A \u201c</span><b><span style=\"color: red;\">TRINITY</span></b><span style=\"color: blue;\">\u201d LIKE OUR BRAHMA/ VISHNU/ SHIVA</span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\">\n</span>\n<br />\n<div style=\"color: blue; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\"></span></span>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">AND SINCE NOBODY KNEW ASSHOLE FROM ELBOW\u2014THEY FUCKED IT UP.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">\n</span></span><span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px;\"><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/05/dvaita-vedanta-of-sanatana-dharma-or.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Arius (256 - 336 AD) was a Libyan theologian and of Berber descent. His father\u2019s name is given as Ammonius. He was educated in the theological school of Antioch (now Antakya)</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Trinity is the Christian name for God. God is a Trinity of three in one, co-equal and yet distinct, called the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The doctrine of the Trinity is the Christian belief is that: There is only ONE God, who is Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The Bible clearly speaks of: God the Son, God the Father, and God the Holy Spirit. But emphasizes that there is only ONE God.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Arius took the position that the three gods of the Trinity are separate gods.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Arius was strongly opposed by his bishop Alexander, who was bishop of Alexandria from 313 AD.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Alexander insisted that the Son was fully and truly God, in as absolute a sense as the Father was.. Alexander assembled a council of Egyptian bishops in 320 which deposed Arius for heresy.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">On earth, COOKED UP Jesus continued to talk to the Father, and the Father and Spirit continued to communicate with him. <span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">The Trinity represented by Christ as a man, the Holy Spirit as a dove, and God as a hand</span></span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">At the First Council of Nicaea in 325 AD ( called by Roman Emperor Constantin the Great ) they stated the crucial formula for that doctrine in its confession that the Son is \u201cof the same substance [homoousios] as the Father,\u201d \u2013they said very little about the Holy Spirit.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">AJJI BHI -- KISSI KOH KUCHCH NAHIN POTHA \u2013NAY --PATHA !</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">###################3</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Several centuries ago, the Pope decided that all the Jews had to leave the Vatican. Naturally there was a big uproar from the Jewish community.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">So the Pope made a deal. He would have a religious debate with a member of the Jewish community. If the Jew won, the Jews could stay. If the Pope won, the Jews would leave.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The Jews realized that they had no choice. So they picked an elderly aged man named Moishe to represent them. Rabbi Moishe's Latin wasn't very good - in fact, he knew very little --- but he was a man of great faith and well respected in the Jewish community. The pope agreed. What could be easier than a silent debate?</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The day of the great debate came. Moishe and the Pope sat opposite each other for a full minute before the Pope raised his hand and showed three fingers.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Moishe looked back at him and raised one finger. The Pope waved his fingers in a circle around his head. Moishe pointed to the ground where he sat.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The Pope pulled out a wafer and a glass of wine. Moishe pulled out an apple. The Pope stood up and said, \"I give up. This man is too good. The Jews can stay.\"</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">CONTINUED TO 2-</span><br />\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_70MN\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px;\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_70BR\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_70B_box\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_71B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4405381294145252505\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_71M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/01/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_15.html?showComment=1516044718498#c4405381294145252505\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">January 16, 2018 at 1:01 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_71MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nAn hour later, the cardinals were all around the Pope asking him what happened.<br />\n<br />\nThe Pope said: \"First I held up three fingers to represent the <span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>TRINITY.&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<br />\nHe responded by holding up one finger to remind me that there was still one God common to both our religions.<br />\n<br />\nThen I waved my finger around me to show him that God was all around us. He responded by pointing to the ground and showing that God was also right here with us.<br />\n<br />\nI pulled out the wine and the wafer to show that God absolves us from our sins. He pulled out an apple to remind me of original sin. He had an answer for everything. What could I do?\"<br />\n<br />\nMeanwhile, the Jewish community had crowded around Moishe. \"What happened?\" they asked.<br />\n<br />\n\"Well,\" said Moishe, \"First he said to me that the Jews had three days to get out of here. I told him that not one of us was leaving.<br />\n<br />\nThen he told me that this whole city would be cleared of Jews. I let him know that we were staying right here.\"<br />\n<br />\n\"And then?\" asked a woman.<br />\n<br />\n\"I don't know,\" said Moishe. \"He took out his dang lunch and so I took out mine.\"<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_72b+seedBDw_D\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_72b+seedBDw_D\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: x-large;\"><b>TEEE&nbsp; &nbsp; HEEEEEEE&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-__Qvz8J1ad4/Wl0EQ4TzdPI/AAAAAAABX-0/iCXiHHptywgooIoYNmJHZrjI2cEqdZ5DQCLcBGAs/s1600/968c5ac3-896U0-4dc9-b6c5-a1a28a35e310.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"340\" data-original-width=\"800\" height=\"272\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-__Qvz8J1ad4/Wl0EQ4TzdPI/AAAAAAABX-0/iCXiHHptywgooIoYNmJHZrjI2cEqdZ5DQCLcBGAs/s640/968c5ac3-896U0-4dc9-b6c5-a1a28a35e310.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n.<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4093553763592258806\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_77M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/01/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_15.html?showComment=1516063668705#c4093553763592258806\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">January 16, 2018 at 6:17 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_77MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nSOMEONE CALLED ME UP OVER THE CNN TV PROGRAM --WHERE IRANIAN JEWESS CHRISTIANE AMANPOUR WAS DISCUSSING LEORNARDO DA VINCI WITH JEW WALTER ISAACSON, THE EX-CHAIRMAN OF CNN.<br />\n<br />\nHE SAID , EVEN IF LEONARDO DA VINCI STOLE 100% FROM TECHNICAL BOOKS OF THE GREAT LIBRARY AT CORDOBA SPAIN.. HE WAS A GREAT ARTIST<br />\n<br />\nBALLS<br />\n<br />\nLISTEN, I HAVE SEEN THEM ALL--I HAVE BEEN ALL OVER ITALY AND SPAIN --AND SO HAS MY ELDER SON<br />\n<br />\nEVERY HEARD OF BERNINI ?<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/12/bernini-unsung-genius-bernini-versus.html</span><br />\n<br />\nLET US ASSUME FR ARGUMENTs SAKE THAT LEONARDO DA VINCI DID NOT STEAL ( ONLY IMAGINE )<br />\n<br />\nHIS TECHNICAL DRAWINGS ARE NOTHING --<br />\n<br />\nI WAS THE FIRST TO SAY THAT PYRAMIDS IN EGYPT WERE BUILT BY WATER FLOTATION POWER--LIKE SHIPS IN THE PANAMA CANAL--THIS IS ON RECORD<br />\n<br />\nLET ME EASE IN SOME MORE<br />\n<br />\nPYRAMIDS WERE BUILT BY KERALA SAGES<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/10/eight-sided-pyramid-of-giza-egypt.html</span><br />\n<br />\nHOW DID THEY GET THE PRECISION--THIS IS BEING TOLD FOR THE FIRST TIME ON THE PLANET--SO HARK<br />\n<br />\nPRECESSION INSTRUMENTS LIKE SPHEROMETER , SCREW GUAGE , VERNIER CALIPERS ETC WERE ALL LIFTED FROM KODUNGALLUR UNIVERSITY<br />\n<br />\nTOTAL INTERNAL REFLECTION WAS AN INDIAN INVENTION..<br />\n<br />\nAncient Indians were the masters of Total Internal Reflection, and faster than light soliton waves. Today we see it used in fibre optics. Total Internal Reflection was a science written down in our Vedic texts 7000 years ago.<br />\n<br />\nTill the white man discovered diamonds in South Africa in 1886, diamonds were available only in India. In 1726 the white man had found some\" low quality\" diamonds on a Brazilian river bed. The next discovery was in 1906 in Congo.<br />\n<br />\nYOU CANT GET THE PRECISION WITHOUT MEASURING INSTRUMENTS AND KNOWLEDGE OF CALCULUS<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/isaac-newton-calculus-thief-capt-ajit.html</span><br />\nA PYRAMID ( ON A MACRO SCALE ) HAS TO BE FIRST DRAWN IN SMALL SCALE ON PAPER--INCORPORATING THE GOLDEN MEAN OF 1.618 AND THE GOLDEN ANGLE OF 51 DEGREES, 49 MINUTES AND 38.25 SECONDS<br />\n<br />\nA DIAMOND ( ON MICRO SCALE ) HAS TO BE ENLARGED ON PAPER<br />\n<br />\nRATNA PARIKSHA was a 5000 year old Sanskrit text on optics which dealt with critical angles, high refractive index of diamond ( 2.4 ) and low critical angle ( 24 deg ) and total internal reflection physics and the art of cutting diamonds, to make it spit fire.. Precision was 100% required as a poor cut brought bad luck<br />\n<br />\nThe EYE OF BRAHMA ( colour changing diamond at middle eye ) would become opaque as soon as it was gouged out and stolen --and it brought a terrible curse. So as soon as the white an stole it , the first thing he did was to cut the diamond ( poorly ).<br />\n<br />\nThis was done even with SYAMANTAKAM ( Kohinoor). Despite cutting it brought bad luck. The queen consulted Indian astrologers and started the BEEF EATER and BLACK RAVEN thingy -it continues even today at the Tower of London<br />\n<br />\nWhen the Sun is low in the sky the rainbow appears relatively high; as the Sun rises higher, the rainbow appears lower in the sky, maintaining the critical 40\u00b0- to 42\u00b0-angle. When the Sun is more than 42\u00b0 above the horizon no rainbow can be seen because the required angle passes over the head of the observer.<br />\n<br />\nThe secondary rainbow has an angular radius of about 50\u00b0 and hence is seen outside of the primary bow. Higher-order rainbows, resulting from three or more internal reflections, are exceedingly weak but can be observed in Kerala in the months of August.<br />\n<br />\nAll this is written in our ancient texts.<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/05/land-of-punt-ophir-and-sheba-is-north.html</span><br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_77BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; text-decoration-line: none;\">January 16, 2018 at 5:57 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_103MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nTHE GOLDEN FISH WAS A MAGNETIC NEEDLE WITH THE RED RUBY EYE ALWAYS POINTING NORTH<br />\n<br />\nTHIS FISH WAS FLOATING ON WATER IN A TRANSPARENT BOWL OVERHEAD WITH A WEAK BOTTOM<br />\n<br />\nTHE BOWL WAS ROTATED AND HENCE THE FISH WAS UNSTEADY, SOMETIMES AHEAD, SOMETIMES FALLING BEHIND<br />\n<br />\nEVEN BY SHOOTING AN ARROW LOOKING UP DIRECTLY --IT WAS NEXT TO IMPOSSIBLE<br />\n<br />\nARJUN NAILED THE FISH BY LOOKING AT THE WATER REFLECTION BELOW<br />\n<br />\nHIS CONFIDENCE IMPRESSED DRAUPADI.<br />\n<br />\nOUR ARJUNA AWARD SHOW THIS<br />\n<br />\nONLY HUMANS CAN SEE THEMSELVES IN THE MIRROR ALONG WITH FEW MAMMALS WHO ARE NEXT IN LINE TO BE HUMANS IN THEIR NEXT BIRTH ( ELEPHANTS/ DOLPHINS/ BONOBOS )<br />\n<br />\nKARNA DID IT BEFORE ARJUNA-- HE WAS AS HANDSOME AS ARJUNA<br />\n<br />\nBUT DRAUPADI CHOSE ARJUNA -- IT WAS HER CHOICE IN A SWAYAMVAR<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_104b+seedy86D\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_104b+seedy86D\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; They saw that the old woman was bringing in wood and heating the oven, and they discovered that she was planning on roasting and eating them. Gretel asked the woman to look inside the oven to see if it was hot enough, and then pushed her in and slammed the door<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/03/st-patrick-genocide-of-druids-pope-leo_30.html</span><br />\n<br />\nMore than 33 % of the European population died of brain disease ( KURU TYPE BRAIN DISEASE ) due to the effects of cannibalism..<br />\n<br />\nWe heard of the MOUSE TOWER OF BINGEN -<br />\n<br />\nThe land of the prince-bishop of Bingen, a district on the Rhine river above Cologne, had suffered a severe short-fall in its harvest, and food was in very short supply. Nevertheless, the bishop demanded that everyone pay him their full rents and taxes in money and in kind. He then used the money to buy up what food remained in the market, and stored all of it in the fortress tower in which he lived. He dismissed all of his dependents and servants, and then shut and locked all of the gates and doors to the tower in order to be sure that people would not try to enter and steal the food he had hoarded there. But he need not have worried about that -- the people were all gone. They had eaten every blade of grass and every kernel of grain in the land. Some had died, while others had fled and left the bishop as the only living person in Bingen. Just as he was congratulating himself on having been clever enough to have survived the great hunger in comfort, he heard noises outside and at the doors. He rushed to the top of the tower and saw a terrible sight. All of the starving rats and mice from the entire region had smelled the food and were hurrying toward his tower.<br />\n<br />\nThere are records of King Edward II, of England and King Louis X of France being starved of food.<br />\n<br />\nHerman Melville commonly made the concept of male homosexuality and cannibalism interchangeable</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/01/blockchain-bitcoin-intrinsic-value-of.html?showComment=1516318422472#c3456797509636442082\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">January 19, 2018 at 5:03 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_107MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nThe base of the idol ( third eye ) and the Dhwaja should be of equal height.<br />\n<br />\nThe height of Dhwaja is fixed-- and this is why no ordinary mortal could consecrate a temple . A hole is made in the roof of the Mandapa where the line of the above angle touches the roof.<br />\n<br />\nThe middle point between the eyebrows of the idol, the hole in the roof and the top of the Dhwaja is in the same line.<br />\n<br />\nThe above angle line when extended should reach the top of the Kalasa the Gali-Gopuram. The Gali-Gopuram should be constructed at thr right distance.<br />\n<br />\nAs the earth axis is tilted to an angle of 23.4 degrees the small hole, the top of the Dhwaja and the top of the Gali-Gopuram should be in a line making an angle of 23.4 degrees with the normal sight line of the idol for the optimum powerful radiation of the directional power.<br />\n<br />\nA TEMPLE STUMBHA IS A QUARTER LAMBDA ANTENNA --NOT FOR ELECTROMAGNETIC WAVES BUT FOR SCALAR WAVES --HOWEVER IT FULLFILLS CONDITIONS FOR ELECTROMAGNETIC SPECTRUM.<br />\n<br />\nEVERY STAMBHA IN ANCIENT TIMES HAS IRRIDIUM AND RHODIUM INHERENT IN THE VAHANA FIGURE OF THE DEITY RIGHT ON TOP. VAHANA MEANS CARRIER ( WAVE ).<br />\n<br />\nToday any incoming missile is shot down in seconds using circular arrays are composed of thousands of crossed dipole antennas.<br />\n<br />\nThe impedance of a 1/4 lambda Marconi antenna is 36.6 ohms.A \u00bd lambda dipole has an impedance of about 70 ohms . Remember scalar energy cannot be measured today--probably they will do it 500 years from today.<br />\n<br />\nTHE FLAG MAST OF A TEMPLE IS PRECISION GEOMETRY.<br />\n<br />\nARANMULA AIRPORT AUTHORITIES ( CHRISTIAN ) WANTED THE FLAG POLE TO BE CROPPED AND REMOVE ARANMULA MIRROR PRODUCTION<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/11/aranmula-airport-kerala-mindless-rape.html</span><br />\n<br />\nDESPITE TELLING PM MODI AT LEAST 60 TIMES-- EVEN LAST YEAR THE TAMIL DALITS / CHRISTIAN NGOs SANG \" DEVI ( SHIVAs WIFE ) NEEDS A PRICK AS LARGE AS THE KODIMARAM TO BE SEXUALLY SATISFIED\"<br />\n<br />\nTHEY DONT KNOW THAT SHIVA AND HIS WIFE ARE COSMIC ALLEGORIES .. text-decoration-line: none;\">January 19, 2018 at 5:37 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_113MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCaptain<br />\n\"Towers of Brahma\" -- a Mathematical problem of moving disks from one stack to another, using only center stack as resting place.. very challenging if the number of disks increase.<br />\nBased on the time it takes if a tower having 64 discs were to move from one column to 2nd column, the world will end by the time the last disc is moved.<br />\n<br />\nThere was some lore that in Varanasi some priests/monks were doing this disc transfers. :-)<br />\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_113BR\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-QJvaVVY36eU/WmGq6LEkWKI/AAAAAAABYEM/eC65c9XsAF07lza98EQGp-3mlGSht-3MgCLcBGAs/s1600/square-spirBal-illustration.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"285\" data-original-width=\"285\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-QJvaVVY36eU/WmGq6LEkWKI/AAAAAAABYEM/eC65c9XsAF07lza98EQGp-3mlGSht-3MgCLcBGAs/s400/square-spirBal-illustration.png\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sruti &nbsp;means the smallest interval of pitch that the\nhuman ear can detect and a singer or musical instrument can produce.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The musical sruti\nconcept is found in ancient and medieval Sanskrit texts such as the Natya\nShastra, the Dattilam, the Brihaddeshi, and the Sangita Ratnakara. &nbsp;Chandogya Upanishad speaks of the division of\nthe octave in 22 parts<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Verse 28.21 of Natya\nShastra introduced the musical scale as follows,(&nbsp; stolen and patented by the white man -- Do,\nRe, Mi, Fa, So, La, Ti--)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0924\u0924\u094d\u0930</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u094d\u0935\u0930\u093e\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sa/(</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">)\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ga/(</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0917</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pa/(</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">)\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dha/(</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0927</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ni/(</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0928\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sa/ (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The music theory in the\nNatyashastra,&nbsp; centers around three\nthemes \u2013 sound, rhythm and prosody applied to musical texts. The text asserts\nthat the octave has 22 srutis or microintervals of musical tones or 1200 cents.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The greeks stole all\nthis while studing at Kodungallur University in Kerala and patented it in their\nown names..&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each sruti computes to\n54.5 cents, while the THIEVING Greek enharmonic quartertone system computes to\n55 cents <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In music, 22 equal\ntemperament, called 22-tet, 22-edo, or 22-et, is the tempered scale derived by\ndividing the octave into 22 equal steps (equal frequency ratios). &nbsp;&nbsp;Each\nstep represents a frequency ratio of 22\u221a2, or 54.55 cents<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The text discusses\ngramas (scales) and murchanas (modes), mentioning three scales of seven modes\n(21 total), some of which are the same as the Greek modes..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For Natya Shastra , read\nall 4 parts of the post below--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/04/kathakali-dance-form-of-kerala-capt.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/04/kathakali-dance-form-of-kerala-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 30,000 years old\npaleolithic and neolithic cave paintings at the UNESCO world heritage site at\nBhimbetka rock shelters in Madhya Pradesh shows music instruments and dance<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The basic concepts of Indian\nclassical music includes shruti (microtones), swaras (notes), alankar\n(ornamentations), raga (melodies improvised from basic grammars), and tala\n(rhythmic patterns used in percussion). Its tonal system divides the octave\ninto 22 segments called Shrutis<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are about 7.3\nmillion ragas (or scales) in Carnatic Music, with around 310 still in use\ntoday.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In music theory, &nbsp;harmonic limit is a way of characterizing the\nharmony found in a piece or genre of music, or the harmonies that can be made\nusing a particular scale.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The term limit is to\ngive an upper bound on the complexity of harmony.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The larger the limit number,\nthe more harmonically complex and potentially dissonant will the intervals of\nthe tuning be perceived&nbsp; \"A scale\nbelonging to a particular prime limit has a distinctive hue that makes it\naurally distinguishable from scales with other limits<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0iPKomXRA28/WmGwfbG6jDI/AAAAAAABYEo/24XEvvjWi0AuBzxHH1k68CzM7B-ObphsACLcBGAs/s1600/Intervaffls_of_Shruti.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-em5_JgoxAXs/WmGxVYyJLhI/AAAAAAABYE0/mGlAk6e_r9Ia6kdW6BnUhCCsD-pGRdS_gCLcBGAs/s1600/22_Shrruti_Organogram.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"208\" data-original-width=\"800\" height=\"166\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-em5_JgoxAXs/WmGxVYyJLhI/AAAAAAABYE0/mGlAk6e_r9Ia6kdW6BnUhCCsD-pGRdS_gCLcBGAs/s640/22_Shrruti_Organogram.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Q-bPd6kih6E/WmGxgq_HT0I/AAAAAAABYE4/vX75_jFyW98CYXRajCf8IdCgSzYQsGFCgCLcBGAs/s1600/22_Shrudti_Organogram_%2528Carnatic%2529.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"382\" data-original-width=\"800\" height=\"304\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Q-bPd6kih6E/WmGxgq_HT0I/AAAAAAABYE4/vX75_jFyW98CYXRajCf8IdCgSzYQsGFCgCLcBGAs/s640/22_Shrudti_Organogram_%2528Carnatic%2529.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-jbUVWHlu5do/WmGyKnSs3FI/AAAAAAABYFE/nqKAcfJOf4gWY-IvRV2d7_RyRtFnX_cAwCLcBGAs/s1600/Ratios_frDequencies_percentage_length_of_the_string_where_22_Shrutis_are_played.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"583\" data-original-width=\"644\" height=\"578\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-jbUVWHlu5do/WmGyKnSs3FI/AAAAAAABYFE/nqKAcfJOf4gWY-IvRV2d7_RyRtFnX_cAwCLcBGAs/s640/Ratios_frDequencies_percentage_length_of_the_string_where_22_Shrutis_are_played.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-CnaTt-heD6M/WmGzDjBGAoI/AAAAAAABYFQ/_GJ5i-OfpksX7uf8t2-c8YC6KZ0nXVGjgCLcBGAs/s1600/Shadjad_Grama_on_a_stretched_string.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"119\" data-original-width=\"797\" height=\"94\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-CnaTt-heD6M/WmGzDjBGAoI/AAAAAAABYFQ/_GJ5i-OfpksX7uf8t2-c8YC6KZ0nXVGjgCLcBGAs/s640/Shadjad_Grama_on_a_stretched_string.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-_OAQVWs3NSo/WmGzWH2QbjI/AAAAAAABYFU/yFLC8q94qqI-eDKr5lA2dPm2YMlp93rZACLcBGAs/s1600/Creation_of_22_Shrutisf_from_7_natural_Shrutis.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"471\" data-original-width=\"736\" height=\"408\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-_OAQVWs3NSo/WmGzWH2QbjI/AAAAAAABYFU/yFLC8q94qqI-eDKr5lA2dPm2YMlp93rZACLcBGAs/s640/Creation_of_22_Shrutisf_from_7_natural_Shrutis.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-bk0Sw229YL0/WmGzyU-WaGI/AAAAAAABYFY/CgIKXhF2b5wt1Pv5abHBrLVjyGHKrg7CwCLcBGAs/s1600/2-Step_DerivatDDion_of_the_frequencies_of_the_1st_7_Natural_Notes.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"371\" data-original-width=\"770\" height=\"308\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-bk0Sw229YL0/WmGzyU-WaGI/AAAAAAABYFY/CgIKXhF2b5wt1Pv5abHBrLVjyGHKrg7CwCLcBGAs/s640/2-Step_DerivatDDion_of_the_frequencies_of_the_1st_7_Natural_Notes.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-6JkSHbEwV_M/WmG0HXNj4sI/AAAAAAABYFc/Jvwh9IAv8HwxOpUAX9-ZZYKksFD-WOpCACLcBGAs/s1600/600px-Major_scale_in_the_chroWmatic_circle.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"594\" data-original-width=\"600\" height=\"395\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-6JkSHbEwV_M/WmG0HXNj4sI/AAAAAAABYFc/Jvwh9IAv8HwxOpUAX9-ZZYKksFD-WOpCACLcBGAs/s400/600px-Major_scale_in_the_chroWmatic_circle.png\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shruti or \u015bruti, is a\nSanskrit / Malayalam word, found in the Vedic texts of Hinduism where it means\nmusical intonation and what is heard in general. It is also an important\nconcept in Indian music, where it means the smallest interval of pitch that the\near can detect.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The musical sruti concept is found in ancient and medieval\nSanskrit texts such as the Natya Shastra, Dattilam, Brihaddesi, the swara\ndiffers from sruti concept in Indian music.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A sruti is the smallest gradation\nof pitch representing the quality of frequency, while a swara is the selected pitches\nfrom which the musician constructs the scales, melodies, the Natya Shastra\nidentifies and discusses twenty two sruti and seven swara per octave.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Of the\ntwenty two sruti, veena scholars identified the 4th sruti to be sa solfege, 7th\nto be ri, 9th as ga, 13th as ma, 17th as pa, 20th to be dha and 22nd as ni\nsuddha svara. Theoretically, a number of sruti are possible, and later music\nscholars of India increased the number of sruti in their studies.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It has been\nused in several contexts throughout the history of Indian music, recent\nresearch has more precisely defined the term Shruti, its difference from Nada\nand Swara, and pinpointed positions on a string to play 22 shrutis.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The meaning\nof shruti varies in different systems, Bharata Muni uses shruti to mean the\ninterval between two notes such that the difference between them is\nperceptible. He formulates jatis, which are classes of melodic structures and\nthese can be further grouped into two gramas\u2014shadja-grama and madhyama-grama.\nThe notes are separated by intervals, as measured in shrutis.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The shadja-grama\nis given by the division, Sa of four shrutis. Abhinavagupta describes an\nexperiment to obtain the correct configuration of shruti in shadja grama. The\nmadhyama-grama is the same, but the panchama has to be diminished by one shruti\nand that is, the panchama of madhyama-grama is lower than that of shadja-grama\nby one shruti, according to Bharata.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shruti is only mentioned as a measure in\nthe music of Bharatas time. In both the gramas, Ri is three shrutis away from\nSa \u2013 there are three perceptible intervals between Sa and Ri, the third of\nthese is called trishruti rishabha.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Likewise, the interval is called dvishruti\nrishabha, and the first ekashruti rishabha. Notes 9 and 13 shrutis from each\nother occur at a ratio of 100,133.33 and 100,150 respectively and are mutually\nsamv\u0101di, the notes that are at the distance of two and 20 shrutis are mutually\nviv\u0101di.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The remaining ones are called anuv\u0101di, the shruti table below shows the\nmathematical ratios considered to correspond to the system described by Bharata\nand Dattilam, along with the comparable notes in common Western 12-TET tuning<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are 12\nuniversally identifiable musical notes (pitch classes of Chromatic scale or\nSwara-prakara) in a Saptak (Octave).They indicate 'a musical note or scale\ndegree, but Shruti is a more subtle division of the octave'.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The recent\nresearch has shown that 10 out of 12 of these notes (Swaraprakaras) have a\n'spread' or a 'region' on a string (Swara-kshetra in Sanskrit) in which, 'any'\nfrequency leads to the perception of the 'same' note by the human ear, and the\nperception 'changes' at both the ends. The remaining 2 notes, namely the\nFundamental frequency (Shadja) and the perfect 5th (Panchama) have a 'single\npoint' on which they are placed on the string by nature.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus, the 10 notes\ngive 20 Shrutis, and along with the 2 points of Fundamental frequency (Shadja)\nand the Perfect 5th (Panchama), a natural system of 22 Shrutis can be observed\nand played on any string.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These 22 Shrutis are\nnot theoretical postulates, but solid musical facts that provide the foundation\nof Indian music, and have been used for centuries<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shruti is intimately\nlinked to the fundamental aspects of Swara.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dhwani (Sanskrit) means\nsound of any kind. Out of all the Dhwanis created in the world, sounds that are\n'musical'\u2014give an experience or perception of a 'musical' sound\u2014are called\nNadas. The sound of a 'clap' is a dhwani, but that of a bell is a nada. The\ncommonest example of nada is a musical sound made on a stretched string under\nconstant tension. There are innumerable 'Nadas' in a Saptak (Octave). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chaturdandi Prakashika\n(Sanskrit) by Venkatamakhin &nbsp;in Shloka 3,\nChapter 2, stated that,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shrutirn\u00c2ma Bhavenn\u00c2da\nVisheshah Swarak\u00c2ranam Nanu N\u00c2sti Swarashrutyorbhedo N\u00c2daikrupayoho<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The swara differs from\nthe sruti concept in Indian music. A sruti is the smallest gradation of pitch\navailable, while a swara is the selected pitches from which the musician\nconstructs the scales, melodies and ragas.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Natya Shastra identifies and\ndiscusses twenty two sruti and seven swara per octave.Of the twenty two sruti,\nveena scholars identified the 4th sruti to be sa solfege, 7th to be ri, 9th as\nga, 13th as ma, 17th as pa, 20th to be dha and 22nd as ni suddha svara.\nTheoretically, an infinite number of sruti are possible, and later music\nscholars of India increased the number of sruti in their studies<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It has been used in\nseveral contexts throughout the history of Indian music. Recent research has\nmore precisely defined the term shruti, its difference from nada and swara, and\npinpointed positions on a string to play 22 shrutis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bharata Muni uses\nshruti to mean the interval between two notes such that the difference between\nthem is perceptible. He formulates jatis, which are classes of melodic\nstructures. These can be further grouped into two gramas\u2014shadja-grama and\nmadhyama-grama. The notes (svaras) are separated by intervals, as measured in\nshrutis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: large;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The shadja-grama is\ngiven by the following division: Sa of four shrutis, Ri of three shrutis, Ga of\ntwo shrutis, Ma of four shrutis, Pa of four shrutis, Da of three shrutis and Ni\nof two shrutis. Abhinavagupta describes an experiment to obtain the correct\nphysical configuration of shruti in shadja grama, Sarana Chatushtai.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>BASSSSS -</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">VEDIC SRUTI THEORY CAME FROM </span><span style=\"color: blue;\">FRACTAL MINDS </span><span style=\"color: red;\">OF 12 STRAND DNA MAHARISHIS</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>INDIAN CLASSICAL PROSODY WAS PENNED DOWN WHEN THE WHITE MAN WAS RUNNING AROUND NAKED (BALLS FLAPPING/ TWATS WHISTLING IN THE WIND ), GRUNT GRUNT FOR LANGUAGE</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>THEY STOLE OUR MUSIC AND DARED TO CALL US SAVAGES&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>NOT ANY MORE !&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/11/fractal-mind-of-srinivasa-ramanujan.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/11/fractal-mind-of-srinivasa-ramanujan.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0giBU0UbEJc/WmG3PJk1ELI/AAAAAAABYFs/QXjJ5EZ5qgA5Yx5OyySzFZskF6rduKnZACLcBGAs/s1600/downRload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"225\" data-original-width=\"225\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0giBU0UbEJc/WmG3PJk1ELI/AAAAAAABYFs/QXjJ5EZ5qgA5Yx5OyySzFZskF6rduKnZACLcBGAs/s640/downRload.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; IS MAKING GRANDIOSE SETS , CALLED GOOD DIRECTION?...<br />\n<br />\nRANI PADMINI WAS A PRINCESS FROM CALICUT KERALA ...<br />\n<br />\nSHE WAS RENAMED PADMAVATHY BY HER RAJPUT KING HUSBAND...<br />\n<br />\nRANI PADMINI WAS PROJECTED IN A LITERARY WORK BY MALIK MUHAMMAD JAYASI 500 YEARS AGO IN AWADHI.... Jayasi wrote a poem Padmavat (1540), describing the story of the historic siege of Chittor by Alauddin Khalji in 1303....<br />\n<br />\nA RAJPUT RULER RATAN SINGH HEARD OF HER GREAT BEAUTY AND STATELY QUALITIES - HE CAME ALL THE WAY FROM RAJASTHAN TO SEE HER . ... HE MARRIED HER AND MADE HER THE QUEEN OF CHITOOR ....<br />\n<br />\nTHE FIRST SHIP TO BE LAUNCHED FROM KOCHI SHIPYARD WAS MT RANI PADMINI COMMANDED BY ONE OF MY FRIENDS...<br />\n<br />\nAllauddin Khilji heard of her from a poet named Raghav Chaitanya--as the most PERFECT WOMAN ON THIS PLANET , BEAUTIFUL, DOCILE AND TRAINED TO BE BHARATIYA NAARI ...<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/12/64-kalas-of-ancient-india-for-girl.html</span><br />\n<br />\nFascinated by Padmini's description, Allauddin Khilji went all the way to Chittor in order to acquire her....<br />\n<br />\nKhilji\u2019s request to have a glimpse of the queen was turned down as Rajput culture forbade women from meeting strangers. ... .<br />\n<br />\nKhilji then waged a war against Chittor where King Ratan Singh fell in battle\u2026. THERE ARE MORE THAN TWO LAKH COMMENTS IN MY BLOGSITE..<br />\n<br />\nMANY READERS COME HERE JUST TO READ THE TAAZA COMMENTS -- NOT MY BLOGS ( WHICH THEY SAY ARE TOO LONG )..<br />\n<br />\nHERE WE GO..<br />\n<br />\nTHE WHOLE OF YESTERDAY TWO BENAMI MEDIA COMMIE TV CHANNELS WERE BITCHING ABOUT BAAAD HINDUS ZEALOTS KILLING ATHEIST RATIONALISTS DHABOLKAR , KALBURGI, PANSARE , GAURI LANKESH ETC.<br />\n<br />\nTHESE PATHETIC COMMIES HAD A SINGLE MISSION-- DENIGRATE HINDUS AND SANATANA DHARMA.<br />\n<br />\nTHEY GOT FOREIGN MONEY AND FAME FOR BRANDING SANATANA DHARMA AS A RELIGION OF EXTREME SUPERSTITION AND PAINTING HINDUS AS SAVAGES..<br />\n<br />\nONE WRITER UC ANANTHAMURTHY PISSED ON A VISHNU IDOL BEING WORSHIPED TO PROVE THAT THE IDOL HAS NO POWERS AND CANNOT HIT BACK.. HE WENT AROUND BOASTING.. OUR COLEGIUM JUDICIARY CRIED \u201c FREEDOM OF EXPRESSION\u201d.<br />\n<br />\nBUT WITHIN A WEEK UC ANANTHAMURTHY HAD KIDNEY PROBLEMS AND TO DEFRAY THE EXPENSES OF EXPENSIVE DIALYSIS THE ITALIAN WAITRESS MADE HIM VC OF AN UNIVERSITY..<br />\n<br />\nOF COURSE UC ANATHAMURTHY WOULD NEVER PISS ON A STATUE OF JESUS / MARY OR THE HOLY KORAN TO BRAND THEM POWERLESS TO STRIKE BACK..<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">ATHEIST RATIONALISTS MUST KNOW THAT SANATANA DHARMA HAS ZERO SUPERSTITION..</span></b></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_34MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><b><br /></b></span>THE DAY MODERN SCIENCE CAN TIDE UP AND BREACH THE LAST FRONTIER TO MEET SANATANA DHARMA AND SEE EYE TO EYE , THERE WILL BE PRALAYA ( COSMIC DISSOLUTION ) DUE TO STAGNATION..<br />\n<br />\nFOR EXAMPLE -- ALBERT EINSTEIN STOLE ALL HIS AWARD WINNING THEORIES FROM VEDANTA..<br />\n<br />\nEINSTEIN JUST PUT SOME MATH AND MADE SUBJECTIVE ANCIENT VEDANTA LOOK LIKE OBJECTIVE MODERN SCIENCE.. THE BEST PART IS THAT HE OUTSOURCED HIS MATH TO INDIA AND HE WAS POOR IN MATH..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2014/08/yellapragada-subbarow-nobel-prize-and.html</span><br />\n<br />\nVISHNU IS A COSMIC ALLEGORY ..AN ENERGY FIELD --JUST LIKE BRAHMA AND SHIVA ON A MACRO AND MICRO SCALE..<br />\n<br />\nA BLOGGER NAMED CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL WAS THE FIRST TO REVEAL THIS.. THAT IS WHY HE IS THE NO 1 WRITER ON THE PLANET WITH PROFILE VIEW OF 739 MILLION...<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br />https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654<br /><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/05/dvaita-vedanta-of-sanatana-dharma-or.html</span><br />\n<br />\nTHE WIVES OF THE TRINITY ARE ALSO COSMIC ALLEGORIES.<br />\n<br />\nFOR EXAMPLE THE WHITE MAN AND COMMIES WHO ARE INVITED FOR DROHI LITERARY FESTS RIDICULED THAT BRAHMA DID INCEST WITH HIS OWN DAUGHTER SARASWATI..<br />\n<br />\nIF YOU GOOGLE \u201c&nbsp;<b><span style=\"color: red;\">BRAHMA INCEST</span></b>&nbsp;\u201c YOU WILL GET 4.8 LAKH POSTS ..<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: magenta;\">SARASWATI ( WIFE OF BRAHMA ) IS THE MIGHTY QUASAR WHICH IS SEVERAL TRILLION TIMES MORE BRILLIANT THAN THE SUN....</span></b><br />\n<br />\nTHE VEDAS WHICH WENT ON ORAL ROUTE FOR 330 CENTURIES BEFORE IT WAS PENNED DOWN 70 CENTURIES AGO REFERS TO SARASWATI..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\">SHIVA WIFE PARVATI ( DEVI/ BHAGAWATI/ DURGA / KALI ) IS A MIGHTY COSMIC ALLEGORY.. IN HER DESTRUCTIVE FORM SHE IS THE BLACK HOLE WHICH CAN DEVOUR ENTIRE GALAXIES IN SECONDS..</span></b><br />\n<br />\nLONG AGO WHEN MEAND MY WIFE CLIMBED UP KUDAJADRI MOUNTAIN, MANY READERS ASKED ME WHY I DID THAT..<br />\n<br />\nWELL MY WIFE DID ORGONE ENERGY MAPPING..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/03/kudajadri-mountain-chitramoola-cave-adi.html</span><br />\n<br />\nIN THE POST ABOVE I WROTE ABOUT DEVI FOLLOWING ADI SHANKARACHARYA AND TELLING HIM NOT TO LOOK BACK.. NOW, DEVI ( WIFE OF SHIVA ) IS ENERGY.. SHE IS NOT A MORTAL WOMAN..<br />\n<br />\nTHE SPOT ADI SHANKARACHARYA LOOKED BACK, DEVI DISAPPEARED AND HE CONSECRATED THE POWERFUL MOOKAMBIKA TEMPLE THERE ..<br />\n<br />\nTHOUGH THE TEMPLE IS IN KOLOOR KARNATAKA, ONLY MALAYALIS DEVOTEES GO THERE ..WE KNOW WHAT IT IS..<br />\n<br />\nTHERE ARE UNDERGROUND WATER CHANNELS FROM THE TOP OF KUDAJADRI MOUNTAIN TO THE INNER SANCTUM OF MOOKAMBIKA TEMPLE..<br />\n<br />\nDURING THESE RECENT FLOODS THE TEMPLE WAS PARTIALLY SUBERGED..<br />\n<br />\nSAME IN GIZA PYRAMIDS.. I HAD WRITTEN ABOUT THE APEX OF THE PYRAMID EMITTING A BLUE PLASMA GLOW WHICH COULD BE SEEN FOR THOUSANDS OF MILES IN ANCIENT TIMES .. THERE ARE WATER CHANNELS FROM THE RIVER NILE UNDER THE PYRAMIDS..<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_34BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<span kind=\"d\">\n</span>\n<br />\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_32B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c1950966935418826789\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_32M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<span kind=\"d\"><cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. ( GEOMETRY OF OM -108), ULAM SPIRAL, LUCAS NUMBERS, PRIME NUMBER MAGIC , ISOTOPE MAGIC -- EMBEDDED IN IT.&nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<span kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span kind=\"d\">THIS IS WHY WE SAY VEDAS WERE DOWNLOADED FROM AKASHA BY MAHARISHIS , AND THERE IS NO MORTAL AUTHOR..</span><br />\n<span kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span kind=\"d\">BY RECITING VEDIC SRUTI EVERY HUMAN CONDITION OR COSMIC CONDITION COULD BE ADDRESSED AND RESOLVED INSTANTLY ..</span><br />\n<span kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span kind=\"d\">SANATANA DHARMA IS BASED ON THE SCALAR LONGITUDINAL WAVE WHICH TRAVELS FASTER THAN LIGHT..</span><br />\n<span kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span kind=\"d\">MY WIFE INTEGRATES ISOTOPE MAGIC ( SRUTI VERSES REDUCED TO DIGITS ) INTO HER DISTANT REIKI\u2014TACHYON ENERGY FASTER THAN LIGHT ..</span><br />\n<span kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span kind=\"d\">MY REVELATIONS NOW JUMP TO&nbsp;<b><span style=\"color: red;\">59.20 %</span></b></span><br />\n<span kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span kind=\"d\">Capt ajit vadakayil</span><br />\n<span kind=\"d\">..</span></div>\n</div>\n<span kind=\"d\">\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_32BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; These bastards lied\nthat&nbsp; founder of the Charvaka school\nwhich propagated HEDONISM is Brihaspati. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The members of this\nRothschild created and backdated school did not believe in ideas such as the\nsoul, karma, reincarnation, moksha , consciousness , or gods<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Religion, they said, is\nnothing but a fraud devised by cunning men who want to take advantage of\nothers. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Till the white invader\ncame to India nobody heard of Madhavacharya who is tom tommed by Rothschild\ncontrolled historians to have been born in1238 AD \u2013 neither did anybody hear of\na book written by him called Sarvadarshansamgraha, which praises atheism and\nAyn Rand ( Rothschild ) materialism called Charvaka ( sic !).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Rothschild&nbsp; historian has written that Brihaspati is\nindeed considered to be the founding father of Charvaka thought. It is his\nverses, for example, that the FAKE Madhvacharya quotes in his\n\"Sarvadarsanasangraha\"\u2014and thus gave credibility .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sorry Brihaspati\nexisted in hoary antiquity, in the times of Shukracharya \u2013who was the political\nadvisor of King Mahabali of Kerala \u2013whom Vishnu killed by assuming the Vamana\navatar.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In their ethics, the Charvakas\nupheld a kind of hedonism: the only goal people ought to pursue is maximizing\nsensual pleasure in life while avoiding pain\u2014the kind that proceeds from\nover-indulgence and instant gratification\u2014the quintessential Ayn Rand\nphilosopy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the FAKE\nand POISON INJECTED Charvaka, the soul is only the body qualified by\nintelligence. It has no existence apart from the body, only this world exists,\nthere is no beyond\u2014the Vedas are a cheat, the \"incoherent rhapsodies of\nknaves\"; they serve to make men submissive through fear and rituals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Charvakas mocked\nreligious ceremonies, calling them inventions of the Brahmins to ensure their\nown livelihood. The authors of the Vedas were \"buffoons, knaves, and\ndemons.\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Charvakas did not\naccept the authority of the srutis and considered them to be human works\nsuffering from incoherent rhapsodies, inconsistencies and tautologie.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
