, serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">HEY CAN WE THROWN IN MOMMA FOR GOOD MEASURE\n\u2013 FOR MOKSHA?</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a man himself sows,\nso he himself reaps; no man inherits the good or evil act of another man. The\nfruit is of the same quality as the action.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2014\u2009Mahabharata,\nxii.291.22-&nbsp; 4000 BC<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the thirteenth book\nof the Mahabharata, also called the Teaching Book (Anushasana Parva), sixth\nchapter opens with Yudhishthira asking Bhishma: \"Is the course of a\nperson's life already destined, or can human effort shape one's life?\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The future, replies\nBhishma, is both a function of current human effort derived from free will and\npast human actions that set the circumstance<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Happiness comes due to\ngood actions, suffering results from evil actions,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">by actions, all things\nare obtained, by inaction, nothing whatsoever is enjoyed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If one's action bore no\nfruit, then everything would be of no avail,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">if the world worked\nfrom fate alone, it would be neutralized.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2014\u2009 Mahabharata,\nxiii.6.10 &amp; 19<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">CHARVAKA WAS COOKED UP\nBY JEW ROTHSCHILD.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FAKE Carvaka, Lokayata\n(the materialists) denied the theory of karma-rebirth-moksha &nbsp;as well as the existence of God.. Jew\nRothschild tried his best to spread HEDONISM in India\u2014it did not work<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ATHEIST Charvaka (\nLokayata ) \u2014the FAKE and backdated philosopher ( 5<sup>th</sup> Century BC )\nnever existed . Charvaka rejected Vedas \u2018<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jew Rothschild created\nand backdated a FAKE Ajita Kesakambali -- Indian philosopher in the 6th century\nBC. &nbsp;He was to tommed as a proponent of\nIndian hedonism and materialism, and forerunner to the Charvaka school.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sarvasiddhanta\nSamgraha states the Charvaka position as follows,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is no other world\nother than this;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is no heaven and\nno hell;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The realm of Shiva and\nlike regions,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">are invented by stupid\nimposters.--</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">\u2014\u2009Sarvasiddhanta\nSamgraha, Verse 8</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Charvaka believed that\nthere was nothing wrong with sensual pleasure\u2014and indulging in rampant sex ,\neven with married women<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sarvasiddhanta\nSamgraha states the Charvaka position on pleasure and hedonism as follows,[53]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The enjoyment of heaven\nlies in eating delicious food, keeping company of young women, using fine\nclothes, perfumes, garlands, sandal paste... while moksha is death which is\ncessation of life-breath... the wise therefore ought not to take pains on\naccount of moksha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A fool wears himself\nout by penances and fasts. Chastity and other such ordinances are laid down by\nclever weaklings.--</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">\u2014\u2009Sarvasiddhanta\nSamgraha, Verses 9-1</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While life is yours,\nlive joyously;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">None can escape Death's\nsearching eye:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When once this frame of\nours they burn,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">How shall it e'er again\nreturn?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Charvakas pointed\nout the disagreements, debates and mutual rejection by karmakanda Vedic priests\nand j\u00f1\u0101nakanda Vedic priests, as proof that either one of them is wrong or both\nare wrong, as both cannot be right<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Charvakas, according to\nSarvadar\u015banasa\u1e43graha verses 10 and 11, declared the Vedas to be incoherent\nrhapsodies whose only usefulness was to provide livelihood to priests. They\nalso held the belief that Vedas were invented by man, and had no divine\nauthority<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Charvakas rejected the\nneed for dharma, &nbsp;ethics or morals, and\nsuggested that \"while life remains, let a man live happily, let him feed on\nghee even though he runs in debt\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Charvakas asserted that\nthere is nothing beyond the senses, consciousness is an emergent property, and\nthat it is foolish to seek what cannot be seen<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>ROTHSCHILD TRIED TO\nREVIVE CHARVAKA HEDONISM USING AMISH TRIPATHI\u2014WHO CONVERTED SHIVA TO A SEX\nSTARVED TRIBAL<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">SORRY , SHIVA IS A\nCOSMIC ALLEGORY</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/09/aghoris-corpse-eaters-of-india-capt.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/09/aghoris-corpse-eaters-of-india-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>WHEN AMISH TRIPATHIs\nASS CAUGHT FIRE ( HE KNEW HE WOULD SUFFER THE SAME FATE AS MF HUSSAIN ) HE\nRETRACTED<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">Amish Tripathi&nbsp;&nbsp;said he does not reject Charvaka philosopy<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">Amish Tripathi spAke; \u201cThe\nCharvakas were atheists as were the samkhyas and mimamsas, who believed in the\nVedas, but not god\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">SORRY YOU CUNT\u2014 CHARVAKAS\nREJECTED VEDAS<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">THIS RASCAL KNOWS SHIT\nABOUT SANATANA DHARMA<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Followers of Sanatana\nDharma did not need to define themselves relative to another religious group,\nas they did not see religion and spirituality as something divisive, which\nneeded to be placed in competing camps.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What makes a culture great is a rich diversity\nof deep thought and free creativity, which is not anarchy, but embracing the\nentire human potential to transcend, whether through religion, art, science,\nmysticism or other disciplines.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This allows each individual to find his or her\npath that will likely have some uniqueness about it, which will be based upon\ninner discovery, not upon outer dictates alone.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">DONT EVER THINK YOU CAN\nDO ENDLESS PUJA , VISIT HUNDREDS OF TEMPLES, RUN AROUND BEATING DHOLAKS&nbsp; SINGING BHAJANS IN VERNACULAR, DIP IN GANGES\nAND OBTAIN MOKSHA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MOKSHA REQUIRES ZERO\nKARMIC BAGGAGE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The path of action\n(karma-marga) is the discipline (tapas) of body, senses and mind. The path of\nknowledge (jnana-marga) is the study of the self (svadhyaya) from the skin to\nthe core and back again. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The path of love of God\n(bhakti-marga) is surrendering (pranidhana) of everything to God\u2014like single\nmessiah/ single holy book SHALLOW religions. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sorry, this is NOT part of Sanatana Dharma<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the second chapter\nof the Yoga Sutras, the Sadhana Pada, Patanjali outlines \u201cthe means to\nliberation.\u201d Within these key principles we find the five kleshas, or obstacles:\nignorance, egoism, attachment, aversion and clinging to life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Klesha is the negative\nstate of mind.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the Yoga Sutras of Patanjali, the five Kleshas are\nthe source of our suffering and are said to bind us to an eternal cycle of\nbirth and re-birth, preventing us from reaching our ultimate goal of\nself-realization (Moksha). The first Klesha, Avidya (ignorance), is the root\nKlesha from which all other Kleshas are born.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The reward one gets\nwhen one gets rid of five kleshas is Moksha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">2.03--\navidyasmitaragadveshabhiniveshah kleshaah</span></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The five afflictions\nwhich disturb the equilibrium of consciousness are - ignorance or lack of\nwisdom, ego, pride of the ego or the sense of 'I', attach ment to pleasure,\naversion to pain, fear of death and clinging to life.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Ignorance is the field\nor source for the four Klesas, viz., Asmita, Raga, Dvesha and Abhinivesa. All\nthese five disorders ruffle the mind like physical malady. Therefore they are\ngreat impediments to meditation. They raise Vrittis and bring about\nfructification of Karmas by coming to depend upon one another for mutual\nsupport. If you eradicate Abhinivesa, Raga and Dvesha currents will die. If you\nremove egoism, these two currents, like and dislike will vanish. The root for\negoism, Raga, Dvesha and Abhinivesa is ignorance. If ignorance is destroyed by\ngetting knowledge of Purusha through Samadhi, the other four Klesas will die by\nthemselves. The Karmas are supported by afflictions and the afflictions are\nsupported by Karmas. This is mutual support. This is a Chakrika or cycle like\nthe analogy of the seed and the tree (Bija-Vriksha Nyaya). These Klesas develop\nthe Mahat Tattva, egoism and Tanmatras. These are the five ties that bind a man\nto the wheel of birth and death \u2013 the impediment to moksha. The most important\nknot is ignorance (Hridaya Granthi). This is the fundamental cause. The other\nfour Klesas are the effects of ignorance. Pain and sin are ignorance only.\nThese manifest in those who have forgotten the true all-blissful and eternally\npure nature of Purusha. Afflictions are of three levels - intellectual,\nemotional and intuitive. Avidya and asmita belong to the arena of intelligence;\nhere lack of spiritual knowledge combined with pride or arrogance billows the\nego, inducing arrogance and the loss of one's sense of balance. Raga and dvesa\nbelong to emotions and feelings. Raga is desire and attachment, dvesa is hatred\nand aversion. Succumbing to exuberant desires and attachments or allowing\noneself to be carried away by expressions of hatred, creates dissonance between\nbody and mind, which may lead to psychosomatic disorders. Abhinivesa is\nintuitive - the desire to prolong one's life, and concern for one's own\nsurvival. Cohering to life makes one apprehensive in dealings with others, and\ncauses one to become selfish and self-centred. The root causes of these five\nafflictions are the behavioural functions and thoughts of the various spheres\nof brain. Avidya and asmita are connected with the conscious frontal brain, and\nthe top brain is considered the seat of the 'T' consciousness. Raga and dvesa\nare connected with the base of the brain, the hypothalamus. Abhinivesa is\nconnected with the 'old' brain or back brain which is also known as the\nunconscious brain, because it retains past subliminal impressions, samskaras.\nThe sadhaka must learn to locate the sources of afflictions, in order to be\nable to clip them in the bud through his yogic principles and disciplines.\nDiscrimination remains shaky as long as false knowledge has not been completely\nremoved. Egoism is the root cause for Raga (attachment to pleasures ). Asmita\nhappens when you identify with the parts of yourself that change\u2014everything\nfrom your mind to your body, appearance, or job title\u2014instead of with the quiet\nplace within you that does not change.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nRoad rage has to do with reptilian instincts ,the amygdala is involved.\nThe amygdala can mistakenly misfire messages of danger creating a chronic state\nof anxiety and panic. The amygdalae react to negative events in many ways,\nincluding activation of your sympathetic nervous system. The results cause you\ngut wrenching turmoil. Because the amygdala helped the ancient cave man\nsurvive, it remained as the brain grew and evolved. Today, it\u2019s rare that we\nface an extreme emergency that requires the amygdale to spring into action, but\nit does so nevertheless.&nbsp; It is the\nclassic \u201cfight or flight response.\u201d A feeling of revenge and retribution , \u201cto\nteach a lesson\u201d&nbsp; to a guy who has \u201ccut\nyou off \u201c is always involved in road rage .&nbsp;\nSome delusional ones even feel that they have been chosen to \u201cbell this\nbad cat\u201d. Road-rage incidents stem from the stimulation of the reptilian mind\n-- a driver experiencing road rage feels threatened and responds aggressively\nto ensure his \u201csurvival\u201d.&nbsp;&nbsp; The reptilian\nbrain is inflexible, compulsive, ritualistic and incapable of learning from\nprevious screw-ups. Territoriality - like many animals, human beings react\nnegatively when we feel our space is threatened by someone else. A mature man\ndoes not engage in self-destructive behavior. Maturity is the ability to bear\nan injustice without wanting to get evenand act within the framework of\ndignity.&nbsp;&nbsp; When you are consumed by rage\nyou hyperventilate , there is an increase in your heart rate, BP and a rush of\nadrenaline, cortisol and other stress-induced hormones. Breathing deeply from\nyour diaphragm is essential to calming and relaxing you. There is nothing\nmystical about the power that breathing has to prevent panic. As you control\nthe rate of your breathing, it sends a subconscious message to the amygdala\nthat there is no need to be stressed.&nbsp;\nJust breathe deep and slow until you feel any butterflies start to\nsettle down. Yoga has NOTHING to do with hyperventilation (&nbsp; patented&nbsp;\nSO HUM&nbsp; ) taught by Sri Sri\nRavishankar. There are many low IQ drivers on the road\u2014remember this.&nbsp; He is NOT busting your balls.&nbsp; He is just trying to reach his destinations\nusing his limited cerebral faculty. You do NOT get angry with stationary trees\nwhich have&nbsp; popped up on your path,\nright? Rage is a complete blackout of the thoughts.&nbsp; Rage only sees its own \"rightness\".&nbsp; Rage does not care if it hurts others, in\nfact it aches to hurt somebody.&nbsp; Rage\nfeels justified in hurting others. Rage detracts from the quality of your life,\ndriving away the people who love you and can help you. According to yoga\nphilosophy, this unchanging part of you is known as the \u201cseer\u201d\u2014the cit, drasta\n(drg), or purusa\u2014that which experiences or \u201csees\u201d the world through the lens of\nthe mind. As Patanjali explains in the Yoga Sutra, the mind\u2014which includes your\nthoughts, emotions, and even the sensory input you receive from your body\u2014is\nthe instrument of perception through which the seer engages with the world\naround you. Asmita, or false identification, is common to everyone because our\nexternal qualities inevitably influence how we see ourselves. The nature of the\nSoul is eternal bliss. What can make it sorrowful except ignorance,\nhallucination, delusion;&nbsp; all this pain\nof the soul is simply delusion.&nbsp; For\ndestroying the following evil Vrittis, raise the opposite good Vrittis given\nagainst each: - Lust (Kama).. Brahmacharya, Mumukshutva.---Anger\n(Krodha)...Love, Kshama (forgiveness), Daya (Mercy), Maitri (friendship),\nSanti, Dhriti (patience), Ahimsa.---Pride (Mada)... Humility (Namrata or\nVinaya).---Greed (Lobha)...Honesty, disinterestedness, generosity, Santosha\n(contentment), Aparigraha (non-covetousness).---Jealousy (Irshya)...Nobility\n(Udarata), magnanimity, Mudita (complacency).---Delusion (Moha)...Viveka\n(discrimination).---Vanity, Hypocrisy (Dambha)...Simplicity.---Darpa\n(arrogance)... Politeness, Hri (Modesty).---Cunningness... Arjava (crookedness)\n(straightforwardness).---Harshness... Mildness.---Attachment\n(Raga)...Vairagya.---Insincerity (Asraddha)...Sraddha (faith).---Chanchalatvam\n(Fickleness)... Determination (Nischaya Vritti).</i></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Karmas are\nsupported by afflictions and the afflictions are supported by Karmas. This is\nmutual support.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Afflictions and actions\nintermix and interact, and the cycles of birth and death roll on. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Actions rooted in\ndesire, greed, anger, lust, pride and malevolence invite adversity, just as\nthose which are free from the spokes of the wheel of desire lead towards the\nstate of ecstasy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Life itself springs\nfrom the admixture of good and bad actions, favourable and unfavourable\nimpressions. These form one's birth,&nbsp;\ntype of human life, span of life and the kind of experiences one has to\ngo through.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the law of karma, every condition in the nature of\nhuman birth and life stem from one's past actions, and are responsible for the\nexperiences, pleasant or otherwise, which one meets in life.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fruits of the\nactions gathered in this&nbsp; past lives&nbsp; are called soul samskaras, which become\nresidual imprints or impressions.&nbsp;&nbsp; Soul\nsamskaras are impressions remaining unconsciously in the mind from past good or\nbad actions, giving rise to pleasure or pain.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samskaras become the cause of future actions. Every action leaves a deep\ntrace in the citta as printing or impression ( samskara ). All the impressions\naccumulated in the citta and which is the fruit of action is what we mean by\nkarm\u0101\u015baya.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-sX2Z3lt6aDM/WlewH8l-vkI/AAAAAAABX60/OzwfFKOMKL8GonjninhynwogjpQdpqIjACLcBGAs/s1600/quote-the-human-sourl-has-sojourned-in-lower-and-higher-forms-migrating-from-one-to-another-according-to-swami-vivekananda-275709.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"400\" data-original-width=\"850\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-sX2Z3lt6aDM/WlewH8l-vkI/AAAAAAABX60/OzwfFKOMKL8GonjninhynwogjpQdpqIjACLcBGAs/s640/quote-the-human-sourl-has-sojourned-in-lower-and-higher-forms-migrating-from-one-to-another-according-to-swami-vivekananda-275709.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karmashayas are of two kinds \u2013 those that must mature (niyata\nvipaka)and those that may not mature (aniyata vipaka). Aniyata Vipaka\nkarmashayas may take one of these three courses: Karma may get nullified by a\nstronger karma of the opposite kind&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A dominant karma may subdue a minor karma\nand may not fructify in the next life. The unfructified minor karma my bear\nfruit in&nbsp; a future birth.&nbsp; Karma can bear\nfruit only when the kleshas exist.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Grains of rice can germinate only when they\nare not burnt and the husk is not removed. At the time of death, the karmashaya\nwill determine the three fruits: type of birth, life span and life experience \u2013\npain or pleasure.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karmashaya contains impressions of deeds \u2013 samskaras \u2013 from\ncountless previous lives. At the time of death, the subtle body, which contains\nthe karmashaya, is transferred to the new body.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Only the gross body is\ndestroyed on death. Most of the karmas will fructify in the next life. In each\nre-birth on earth , we acquire some bad karma and some good karma.&nbsp; Only conscious humans have bad karma baggage\n.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Animals do NOT have karma as they have never risen beyond their mooladhara\nchakra.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In each incarnation we suffer the consequences of some of our previous\nbad karma \u2013and every human soul has a&nbsp;\nresultant karmic baggage plus some picked up samskaras , which affect\ncurrent life on the planet , like phobias , deep rooted vices etc .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Though\nweighed down by past life samskaras , the soul ( ball of energy ) within you is\na part of the mother field of brahmAn ( god ) The Universe is&nbsp; not inanimate but conscious; it records our\nactions and provides feedback to us for our psychic growth through the\nmechanism of karma.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This karma gets recorded in the form of inchoate formations\nin the higher mental worlds.&nbsp; These\nformations get fleshed out as they descend through the various planes of\nconsciousness until they materialize at the appropriate time as events in the\nphysical world. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Happy or painful\nexperiences are based on whether the thoughts, feelings or actions that produce\nthem were \"virtuous\" or \"vicious\". This is the basis law of\nkarma.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Virtuous deeds are those that follow the universal moral code. Vice,\napunya, produces a short life which is stressful (paritapa) and gives painful\nexperiences. Virtue,&nbsp; punya, produces\ngood karma resulting in happy (hlada) experiences. There is NO escape from laws\nof Karma .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Organised religion applies severe retribution method at the hour of\njudgement \u2013 Sanatana Dharma applies Karma. Willfully and knowingly\ntransgressing the laws of the universe generates a lot more negative karma than\nunintentional or ignorant transgressions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whenever you act with intention you\ncreate Karma. Actions are considered to be thoughts, emotions, words and deeds,\nand the motive, desire and intent behind each. The purpose of Karma is to\nattain harmony.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although many of the major events in your life are\nastrologically predestined, , god has given you consciousness and free will to\nmitigate the impact of the event, or to transcend it entirely. Beliefs can be\nchanged when you recognize those that are not working for you, and begin\nprogramming what will create success and harmony in your life.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You are NOT an animal\u2014you are a conscious\nhuman with free will and the power to choose.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nThe unlimited creative power of your mind, through dedication, awareness\nand training, can be the wisdom to rise above your Karma.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanatana Dharma guides you in this aspect.\nThere are no accidents in the way the cosmos works.Your energy, translated into\nthoughts, words, emotions, and deeds, causes all your experiences.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This assures\nthat you always have the learning opportunities you require to resolve your\nKarma, and, as with you, the collective thoughts, words, emotions, and deeds of\nmankind create the environment for us all. The purpose of karma is to attain\nharmony and balance.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The universe is perfectly balanced. When you are in\nharmony you are in balance. Until you have resolved your Karma and fulfilled\nyour Dharma, you will continue to reincarnate into sequential lifetimes upon\nthe earth.&nbsp; You decide what lessons you\nneed to learn for each life experience.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whenever you act with intention\n(actions being your thoughts, emotions, words and deeds and the motive, intent\nand desire) you create karma.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nDis-harmonious acts, are rooted in fear-based emotions, must be\neventually balanced and resolved.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you can live a life of perfect harmony,\nliberation will follow. Karma can be experienced in pain and suffering, or it\ncan be experienced in grace. The choice is yours. If you give love , fairness\nwith grace , you will receive the same in return.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma is simply an opportunity to make good\nby CHANGE \u2013&nbsp; it neither punishes nor\nrewards; it simply guides.&nbsp; Karma is a\nmatter of basic cause-and-effect without the need of a deity to mediate the\neffects.The law of karma is not the cause of suffering,&nbsp; it is merely the change agent.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma is\nself-balancing divine justice; it is 100% fair and absolutely infallible.&nbsp; It doesn't matter if a criminal seems to GET\nAWAY WITH IT \u2013 see evil Jew Rothschild has got away with it.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is no\ngetting away with it \u2013 karma will eventually catch up with him&nbsp; -if not in this life then the next life.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After doing sins no dip in Ganges, no puja, no pilgrimage , no endless prayers\nto god can lessen the weight of your karmic baggage.&nbsp; It can be reduced only by good karma.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma\nis not some mysterious metaphysical, or supernatural, force or power that somehow\ncomes back to haunt you.&nbsp;&nbsp; Karma is\nsimply what we do in a conscious manner . Karma is a Sanskrit word meaning\n\"action\".&nbsp; Karmic baggage is a\nresultant \u2013 and is negative bad karma.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Experience of happiness is due to attachment\nto objects and that of suffering is caused by hatred or dislike for an object.\nThe karmashaya (storehouse of karma) is a result of these experiences.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the\nsenses are accustomed to short experience of happiness, they are not inclined\nfor renunciation since their attachment is increased. For a Yogin, even these pleasant\nexperiences are source of ultimate misery and he shuns attachment to these\nobjects.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Greed and infatuation are the\ncause of aversion which brings misery as one pursues to overcome the source of\naversion<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SINCE ADI\nSHANKARACHARYA ( 2000 BC )&nbsp; ALL HINDU\nGURUS HAVE BEEN IGNORANT ON THIS SUBJECT&nbsp;\nOF KARMA\u2014THIS INCLUDES VIVEKANANDA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IT TOOK A CAPT AJIT\nVADAKAYIL TO DECLARE THAT THERE IS NO HEAVEN OR HELL IN HINDUISM<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THERE IS NO HEAVEN OR\nHELL IN HINDUISM.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ONCE YOU TAKE BIRTH AS\nA CONSCIOUS HUMAN&nbsp; YOU DON\u2019T GO BACK TO A\nLOWER FORM OF LIFE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THERE IS NO GOD AT THE\nPEARLY GATES , AT THE HOUR OF YOUR JUDGEMENT, LIKE SINGLE MESSIAH RELIGIONS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHEN YOU SIN YOU WILL PAY\nFOR IT 100%,&nbsp; BY INCREASING THE WEIGHT OF\nYOUR KARMIC BAGGAGE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PUJARIS WHO SAY THEY\nWILL DO EXPENSIVE PUJAS AND GIVE YOU FORGIVENESS FROM GOD, ARE JUST FLEECING\nYOU .</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Hinduism, karma is\nthe force of retributive justice that compels believers to behave righteously\naccording to Dharma\u2014the moral order of the universe.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Hindu knows, that\nhe Karma is in his own hands . This is why a Hindu is the same outside doors\nand within doors.&nbsp; He does NOT even hold\nan evil or slimy thought within his head.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma is the Hindu view\nof causality in which good deeds, words, thoughts, and commands lead to\nbeneficial effects for a person, and bad deeds, words, thoughts, and commands\nlead to harmful effects<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is the reason why\nI can walk with my wife ( loaded with jewelry ) at midnight after a wedding\nreceptions on the deserted beach at midnight.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\nA poor beggar sleeping on the street , would not entertain a though of\nattacking her because even such a thought is bad karma.&nbsp; He knows that he will be re-born after death\n,and he wants a better life in his next birth .&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Communists did mass\nmurder because Rothschild took away this fear of divine retribution by\ncementing the ridiculous evolution theory of&nbsp;\na MAD MAN named Charles Darwin. .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma is a central\ncomponent of the Hindu ethical worldview. Further, because Hindu religious\nordinances govern not just the individual believer but society as a whole,\nbelief in karma enforces and perpetuates systems of social organization\nprescribed in Hindu scriptures. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A POOR DALIT CAN HAVE A\nHOP AND SCREW ALL THE FEMALES HE WANTS AND HAVE A CAREFREE LIFE \u2014&nbsp; WHILE THE RICHEST AND MOST POWERFUL HIGH\nCASTE BRAHMIN CAN HAVE A LIMP PRICK AND 5 ASSHOLES , DUE TO CHRONS DISEASE .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AFTER ALL CHRISTIANITY\nSAYS THE BIG BANG HAPPENED IN 4004 BC .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HOW CAN MAHAVIRA BE\nBORN BEFORE THE BIG FUCKIN\u2019 BANG ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PRAY ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PRITHEE ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The shallow minded\nwhite invader tried to give a spin to Karma. He wrote that since Karma affects\nonly you , you can do whatever you want in life \u2013 after all it is all about\nyou. Consequently, it would promote self-centeredness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Only a morbid and petty\nmind can even think this way.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Hindu teaching of\nkarma is meant to help us overcome. We should not accept an understanding of\nkarma that promotes the it\u2019s-all-your-own-fault mindset just to satisfy our\ndemand of fairness based on the crude conception that all is fair if everyone\ngets what he deserves. Good karma or bad karma affects the whole society.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanatana Dharma has\nnever allowed a Hindu to be selfish and leave out society or even flora/fauna\nfrom the equation.&nbsp;&nbsp; The questions of\n\u201cWhy me?\u201d and \u201cWhy not me?\u201d arise in the minds of JOHN GALT type of ego driven\nselfish individuals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Contrary&nbsp; what the white man thinks , karma helps a\nHindus to live his life by design\u2014 and never by&nbsp;\ndefault.&nbsp;&nbsp; A petty western mind\nwith a closed heart will never understand this.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Hindu sleeps well at\nnight, because he has a clean conscience \u2013 for he has never stitched up anybody\nand that includes flora/ fauna.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\nSanatana Dharma is clear with conscience powered guidelines ( not rules\n) \u2013 there is NO need for a Hindus to over analyze and then declutter his mind\nor tonsure the past with booze and drugs. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Hindu has the unique\nabilty to play a bad hand well. This is why a poor Hindu is happy.&nbsp; Have you seen how rip-roaring our festivals\nare .&nbsp; Check out the zest and enthusiasm\nfor simple things of life . Have you seen an Indian crowd during a cricket game\n?&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kindness, generosity,\npatience, tolerance, humility, fairness , helping others to grow and reach\ntheir potential -- all create happiness.&nbsp;\nA Hindu does NOT allow beautiful things to own him.&nbsp; Happiness is NOT in the mundane, but in the\ndeep ocean of happiness that lies beneath.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I would rather go to\nbuy veggies and fruits with my wife or play a game&nbsp; with my son , rather than go to Taj and meet\nPrince Charles , hoping that my mug will come in the next days newspaper.&nbsp;&nbsp; Dignity consists not in possessing honors,\nbut in the consciousness that we deserve them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All seasons are\nbeautiful for the person whose happiness comes from within. The happiness of a\nman in this life lies in the mastery of his passion</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AFTER THE GAME OF LIFE\n, THE KING AND THE PAWN GOES INTO THE SAME BOX--&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; WHAT IS ALL THIS BULLSHIT&nbsp; ONE-UP-MANSHIP WHILE ALIVE ? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ALL OF US ARE IN RAFTS\nON A RAPID RIVER HEADING FOR THAT PLUNGE DOWN THE WATER FALL OF DEATH&nbsp; --&nbsp; THE\nONLY THING&nbsp; 100% SURE !!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These two words remind\nthe student of the LAWS OF KARMA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That his soul ( a tiny\nball of energy ) within him is who is really is. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That this ball of\nenergy is part of mother energy field brahmAn\u2014the morphonegetic consciousness\nfield ( GOD )&nbsp; , which cannot be detected\nby the 5 human senses.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Creator Ishvara ( god )\ndoes NOT rule over the world through the law of karma.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Sanatana Dharma only\nyou can save yourself.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is why we do NOT\nhave a Pope ( middleman who wears funny robes )&nbsp;\nwho can forgive you .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Hindu does NOT care\nfor the pearly gates of heaven and the HOUR OF JUDGEMENT\u2014where he will be at\nthe mercy of some god<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, there is NO\nheaven of hell concept in Hinduism<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Human beings can lessen\n/ increase the accumulated karmic baggage ( SANCHITA ) in four ways:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through thoughts&nbsp; ( a pujari who ogles at a woman\u2019s cleavage\nwhen she bows down to receive prasadam , accumulates bad karma even as he sits\non his mangy ass in the temple )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through right attitude\nwords<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through actions that we\nperform ourselves&nbsp; ( it hardly matters if\nyou hide and do it )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through actions others\nperform under our instructions or influence</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Everything that we have\never thought, spoken, done or caused is karma.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nKarma ( literally means deed ) refers to the totality of our actions and\ntheir concomitant reactions in this and previous lives, all of which determine\nour future.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The lessening of karmic\nbaggage lies in intelligent action and dispassionate reaction. Not all karmas\nrebound immediately. Some accumulate and return unexpectedly in this or other\nlifetimes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/zFdxGE77vvD2w5xHy6jkVuElKv-U9_9qLkRYK8OnbDeJPtjSZ82UPq5w6hJ-SA=s35\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c7285490538536107313\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-decoration-line: none;\">January 12, 2018 at 4:54 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_20MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCaptain,<br />\n<br />\nAs per IITK sanskrit ramayan project, here is one sloka.. where they spcifically say Sugriva is a monkey and others are monkeys too.<br />\n<br />\nYour comments please?<br />\n<br />\n----<br />\n\u0924\u0924\u0936\u094d\u0936\u093e\u0916\u093e\u092e\u0943\u0917\u093e\u0938\u094d\u0938\u0930\u094d\u0935\u0947 \u092a\u094d\u0932\u0935\u092e\u093e\u0928\u093e \u092e\u0939\u093e\u092c\u0932\u093e\u0903\u0964<br />\n<br />\n\u092c\u092d\u091e\u094d\u091c\u0941\u0936\u094d\u091a \u0928\u0917\u093e\u0902\u0938\u094d\u0924\u0924\u094d\u0930 \u092a\u0941\u0937\u094d\u092a\u093f\u0924\u093e\u0928\u094d\u0926\u0941\u0930\u094d\u0917\u0938\u0902\u0936\u094d\u0930\u093f\u0924\u093e\u0928\u094d4.2.10\u0964\u0964<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n\u0924\u0924\u0903 then, \u092a\u094d\u0932\u0935\u092e\u093e\u0928\u093e\u0903 jumping, \u092e\u0939\u093e\u092c\u0932\u093e\u0903 extremely strong, \u0938\u0930\u094d\u0935\u0947 all, \u0936\u093e\u0916\u093e\u092e\u0943\u0917\u093e\u0903 monkeys, \u0924\u0924\u094d\u0930 there, \u0926\u0941\u0930\u094d\u0917\u092e\u094d \u0938\u0902\u0936\u094d\u0930\u093f\u0924\u093e\u0928\u094d near hilly side, \u092a\u0941\u0937\u094d\u092a\u093f\u0924\u093e\u0928\u094d fully blossomed, \u0928\u0917\u093e\u0928\u094d trees, \u092c\u092d\u091e\u094d\u091c\u0941\u0903 shattered<br />\n<br />\nThen the mighty monkeys jumping on the trees in full bloom shook them.---</div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_20BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In earthly life,&nbsp; the soul gains many more Samskaras or experiences\nthrough actions and these are added to the original store and become the future\nSanchita Karmas (accumulated actions).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All Samskaras lie\ndormant in the Chitta as latent activities, not only of this life but of all\nprevious innumerable lives from Anadi Kala (beginningless time).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The gross body and the\nmind have, on account of your past Karmas, a tendency to act in a certain way\nand you act just in accordance with that tendency like a machine. Most of your\nactions are done more or less automatically. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your next life will\ndepend very largely upon the Karma you perform in this birth.&nbsp;&nbsp; From Samskaras emanate Vasanas like swarms\nof locusts.&nbsp; From Vasana flows the stream\nof desire and from enjoyment of objects of desires arises Trishna or internal\ncraving (intense longing).</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Try to acquire some\ngood spiritual Samskaras in this birth at least.&nbsp; Do some kind of meditation for a short time\ndaily for mental clarity. New, healthy Samskaras can be implanted by new,\nhealthy suggestions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The physical body may\ndie. But, the thoughts and Samskaras of actions, enjoyments and thinking follow\nyou after death till your soul attain Moksha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; BALLS HE\nSAID THAT !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
