THIS WAS REPLAVED BY HAMUMANS FIGURE.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/09/garuda-vimana-of-vishnu-and-garuda.html</span></span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">TODAY IN ALL WRESTLING AKHADAS THEY KEEP PICTURES OF HANUMAN AND BHIMA --AN THESE STUPID WRESTLERS EAT , FART AND SLAP THEIR THIGHS .. NOW THIS IS COPIED BY KABADDI PLAYERS</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">ROTHSCHILD MADE HNUMAN SON OF SHIVA-- BALLS ! JUST TO SHOW SHIVA FOLLOWERS ARE LESSER THAN VISHNU FOLLOWERS--DIVIDE AND RULE</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">shankara suvana kesar\u012b nandana\u0964 teja prat\u0101pa mah\u0101 jaga bandana\u0965 6 \u0965</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">O son of Shiva (or son of V\u0101yu carrying the power of Shiva), the delighter of Kesari, your aura and majesty is great and is revered by the whole world</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">tuma upak\u0101ra sugr\u012bvahi k\u012bnh\u0101\u0964 r\u0101am mil\u0101ya r\u0101japada d\u012bnh\u0101\u0965 16 \u0965</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">You did Sugriva a great favour by making him meet Rama and bestowing on him the kingdom of Kishkindha.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">SUGRIVA WAS A MAN --NOT A MONKEY</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/10/king-vali-and-queen-tara-of-ramayana.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">uga sahasra jojana para bh\u0101n\u016b\u0964</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">l\u012blyo t\u0101hi madhura phala j\u0101n\u016b\u0965 18 \u0965</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The Surya, sun was swallowed by you after you assumed him to be a sweet fruit. BALLS --RIDICULOUS</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">jo shata b\u0101ra p\u0101tha kara ko\u012b\u0964 chh\u016btahi bandi mah\u0101 sukha ho\u012b\u0965 38 \u0965</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">One who recites Hanuman Chalisa a hundred times (or for hundred days) is released from bondage ( MOKSHA ) and obtains great bliss\". BALLS !</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">jo yaha parhai hanum\u0101na ch\u0101l\u012bs\u0101\u0964 hoya siddha s\u0101kh\u012b gaur\u012bs\u0101\u0965 39 \u0965</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">One who reads this Hanuman Chalisa obtains Siddhi (accomplishment or liberation). Shiva himself bears witness to this statement-- BALLS !</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">tulas\u012bd\u0101sa sad\u0101 hari cher\u0101\u0964 k\u012bjai n\u0101tha hridaya maha der\u0101\u0965 40 \u0965</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Tulsidas is always a devotee of Hari. O Lord, make my heart your abode.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">-- CHOOT TULSIDAS NEVER EXISTED</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">pavantanaya sankata harana mangala m\u016brati r\u016bpa\u0964 r\u0101ma lakhan s\u012bt\u0101 sahita hridaya basahu sura bh\u016bpa\u0965</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">O Son of V\u0101yu, remover of adversities, one with an auspicious form, and the chief among all Devas, may you reside in our hearts along with Rama, Lakshman and Sita-- BALLS HANUMAN IS CHIEF AMONG DEVAS--HE IS JUST A MONKEY IN RAMAYANA. RAMA IS THE GOD.. WE HAVE RAMA IDOLS IN TEMPLES&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">capt ajit vadakayil</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">..</span></div>\n</li>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma goes hand-in hand\nwith reincarnation since rebirth is the means to exhaust all the consequences\nof our karma. Our present has been created by our past and our future is taking\nshape through every moment that we live - through every thought, word and\naction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ALL CHUTNEY MARYs AND\nPICKLE JOHNS ASK A QUESTION BEFORE THEY LIFT A FINGER TO DO WORK \u201c WHAT IS IN\nIT FOR ME \u201d&nbsp;&nbsp; -- OR \u201cYEH KAAM KARNE SE\nHAMAARA FAAYADA KYA HOENGA ?\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bhagavad Gita has\nbeen advocating nishkama karma - desireless action - since time immemorial. It\nsays \u201cYour choice is in action only, never in the result thereof. Do not be the\nauthor of the result of action. Let your attachment not be to inaction\u201d (2-47)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Krishna says that if\nyou do Nishkam karma, you won't suffer the consequences of your karma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When acting out of\nNishkam Karma, an individual is acting without any expectation that good will\nbe returned to him/her. In Sanskrit, nishkam means \u201caction without SELFISH&nbsp; motive,\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Karma yoga\nphilosophy, there are two central concepts: Sakam Karma and Nishkam Karma.\nSakam Karma is to take action under self-centered motivations with the goal of\nbeing thanked or receiving goodness in return. Nishkam Karma is the opposite of\nSakam Karma and is considered to be selfless action without even the subtle\ninternal hope for a \u201cthank you\u201d or goodness returned.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ultimately, Nishkam\nKarma is considered non-attachment to the result of personal actions in life,\nbut with selfless and loving motives. The karmic concept centers on whatever\nactions a yogi makes within the world for the sake of others and not for\nself-benefit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The purpose of life is\nliberation or moksha. Nishkama karma or detaching one\u2019s actions from personal\nreward helps us to attain this purpose. However, in the final analysis, the\nchoice rests with us.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Arjuna was being\nadvised by Krishna to fight in the battle, he asked Krishna a very important\nquestion - <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arjun: \"Isn't\nkilling people bad and unethical? If so, then why, oh Krishna, are you telling\nme to kill the Kauravas? Wouldn't I be sowing the seeds of bad karma which\nwould then hurt me when they reap?\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To which Krishna\nreplied:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Krishna: \"Hey\nArjun, perform nishkam karma, ie fight in the battle without any desire or\nexpecting any result for yourself. Then this karma would not be considered as a\nsin. Pick up your weapons because this is your dharma, or\nresponsibilities.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">\u201cThy right is to work\nonly, but never to its fruits; let not the fruit-of-action be thy motive, nor\nlet thy attachment be to inaction.\u201d \u2500 Swami&nbsp;\nChinmayananda</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedas have been divided\ninto four styles of texts \u2013 the Samhitas (mantras and benedictions), the\nAranyakas (text on rituals, ceremonies, bloodless sacrifices and\nsymbolic-sacrifices), the Brahmanas (commentaries on rituals, ceremonies and\nsacrifices), and the Upanishads (text discussing meditation, philosophy and\nspiritual knowledge).&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All of them were penned\ndown in 5000 BC.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samhita has prayers or\nSuktas.&nbsp; Brahmana has yajna methods.&nbsp; Aranyaka has Mantras and methods that are\npracticed in the forests&nbsp; (not for\ngrihasta stage ) .&nbsp;&nbsp; Upanishads normally\nappear in the last part of Aranyaka and deal with spiritual philosophy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brahmanas ( part 2 ) an\nAranyakas ( part 3 ) have been stolen by the white invader for the science and\nmath value. &nbsp;&nbsp;Brahmanas and aranyakas\nhave been stolen during the rule of the white invader\u2014who extracted the essense\n, patented in their own names and destroyed the originals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The Brahmanas, were mostly in prose. Brahmanas\nexpound Karma, Samsara, re-births and moksha.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Aranyakas, served\nas a link between the Brahmanas and the Upanishads<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white invader left\nbehind poison injected brahmanas and aranyakas to make the Hindu look stupid\u2014nay\u2014like\nwild monkeys..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white invader\nthought that Samhita (Sruti verses ) part 1 were useless set of words . Samhita\nrefers to the most ancient layer of text in the Vedas, consisting of mantras,\nhymns, prayers, litanies and benedictions.. Mantras are combination of letters\naccording to euphonic rules- which gives bliss to the heart.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These contain mantras \u2013\nsacred sounds Vedic Samhita refer to mathematically precise metrical archaic\ntext of each of the Vedas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">India has wowed the\nworld with the wisdom inherent in Upanishads \u2013or Vedanta ( part 4 )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Samhitas and the\nBrahmanas form the Karma-Kanda segment of the Vedas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">LYING JEWESS Wendy\nDoniger O'Flaherty has translated some stories from the Jaiminiya Brahmana,\nillustrating\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201c how they dealt with\nthe fears of death, God, the father, wives, and demonic women; many of these\nstories are sexually explicit, indicating that these people were not afraid of\ndiscussing their sexuality.. However, since the usual way of handling these\nfears was to use a sacrificial ritual \u201c<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sorry you lying JEWESS\n\u2013 all animal sacrifices and debauched sex in Hinduism were injected by the\nwhite invader.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No nation, no country,\nno culture in this age of science has been able to produce such profound truths\nand wisdom as in the&nbsp; Aranyakas.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yet we give a lot of\nimportance in the modern age to Upanishads alone- ( 4th part /Vedanta )\nbasically because almost all Aranyakas have been stolen by the white invader<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Aranyakas were full\nof secret explanations about the Veda samhitas ( sruti verses ) -- the\nallegorical meaning of the ritual , power of the longitudinal sound wave , the\ninternal, meditative meaning of the bloodless sacrifice, as contrasted to its\nactual, outward performance.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Aranyaka\"\niterally means \"produced in wilderness\". These were deep\ncontemplations by maharishis who moved out of their homes in vanaprasta/\nsanyasa stages of life<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But only in human\nbeings is the Atman [soul] obvious,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">for they are equipped\nwith cognition.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They speak what they\nhave understood.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They see what they have\nrecognized,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">and know what will\nexist tomorrow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They know of this world\nand of the other.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through that which is\nmortal, they strive for immortality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They are equipped with\nall this...<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">such a human being is\nan ocean.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He partakes of\neverything in the world,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">and still his thoughts\ngo beyond it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And even if he were to\npartake of the other world,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">his thoughts would also\ngo beyond it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2014Aitereya Aranyaka\n2.3.2 \u2013 2.3.3,-- 5000 BC<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aranyakas deal with\nSAMYAMA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I HAVE DEALT WITH\nSMAYAMA IN THE MOVIE REVIEW BELOW\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/08/the-thin-red-line-movie-review.html\"><span style=\"background-color: lime; font-size: large;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/08/the-thin-red-line-movie-review.html</span></a><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yama and Samyama form\nthe start and culmination of yoga practices. Yama is personal practices\nconsisting of ahimsa (noninjury), satya (truthfulness), asteya (not\nappropriating what belongs to others), brahmacharya (moving toward Ultimate\nTruth or Brahman), and aparigraha (nonacceptance of gifts).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is followed by\nNiyama which are restraints of saucha (purity), santosha (content), tapah\n(penance), svaadyaaya (study), and Isvara pranidhana (surrender to a higher\nprinciple). Samyama is bringing together the last three stages of the practices,\nnamely, dharana, dhyana, and samadhi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The natural outcome of\npractice of Yama and Niyama is these altruistic attitudes regarding welfare and\nlove toward others who also go through ups and downs of life. Yama and Niyama,\nif practiced truthfully and fully, become mahavrata or great commitments that\ntranscend time, space, and situations.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Further, the entire environment around\nthe person becomes charged with these virtues and hostility is not seen in his\npresence<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ultimate goal of\npracticing yoga is to achieve transcendence and to break this cyclic existence.\nDharana, dhyana, and samadhi are the three states that prepare one toward this\ntranscendental goal.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These three together is called Samyama (sam meaning total\nand yama meaning to control). &nbsp;Samyama\nmeans complete mastery over the psychic process or complete control of mental\nconcentration.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ego is broken\neither by internal self-analysis or by objective concentration. Both ways are\nequally applicable and effective.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is the ego that prevents us from\nconcentrating ourselves on anything, because the ego has a notion of the\nvariety of things, and a need for appropriating various diverse characters for\nits own satisfaction. And inasmuch as we are preventing this kind of contact\nand satisfaction, it resents all forms of concentration of mind.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samyama is the greatest\nsynthesis of human consciousness, the synthesis of three: dharana, dhyan,\nsamadhi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Attention leads to\nconcentration (dharana).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Concentration leads to\nmeditation (dhyana).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meditation leads to\nabsorption (samadhi).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meditation (along with\nconcentration and samadhi) is a tool for examining the inner world, so as to\nexperience the center of consciousness. With meditation, there is still an\nobserver observing an observed. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the observer becomes\nso absorbed in the process of observing the object that there seems to be only\nthe object, that is the beginning of samadhi. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is as if the\nobserver, the process of observing, and the object being observed all three\ncollapse in such a way that the only thing remaining is the object. When this\ndeep absorption happens, meditation becomes samadhi. he ability to allow\nconcentration to go into meditation, and to then allow meditation to go into\nsamadhi is a process called samyama.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samyama means perfect\ncontrol of the mind.&nbsp; Samyama is a name\nfor three inseparable processes of Dharana, Dhyana and Samadhi taken\ncollectively. By the practice of Samyama, the Yogi gets knowledge and powers. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The three processes are\npractised on any one object successively at the same time. When a man can\ndirect his mind to any particular object and fix it there, and then keep it\nthere for a long time, separating the object from the internal part, this is\nSamyama<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samyama is a powerful\nweapon for the Yogi. Just as the archer aims at the gross objects at first, and\nthen takes to subtle objects, so also the Yogi does Samyama on gross objects\nand then takes to subtle objects. He does great deal of practice and ascends\nthe Yogic ladder rung by rung. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When one has succeeded\nin making this Samyama, all powers come under his control. This is the great\ninstrument of the Yogi. The objects of knowledge are infinite, and they are\ndivided into the gross, grosser, grossest and the fine, finer, finest and so\non. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This Samyama should be\nfirst applied to gross things, and when you begin to get knowledge of this\ngross, slowly, by stages, it should be brought to finer things. When the mind\nhas attained to that state when it identifies itself with the internal\nimpression of the object, leaving the external, and when, by long practice,\nthat is retained by the mind and the mind can get into that state in a moment,\nthat is Samyama. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the Yogi can make a\nSamyama on these past impressions in the mind, he will begin to remember all\nhis past lives.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a Yogi makes a\nSamyama on his own Karma, upon those impressions in his mind which are now\nworking, and those which are just waiting to work, he knows exactly by those\nthat are waiting when his body will fall.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">BY HARNESSING YOUR EGO,\nYOU LIGHTEN YOUR KARMIC BAGGAGE<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">EGO LADEN, BASTARD ,&nbsp; \u201cSON OF A\nBITCH\u201d MEN HAVE GONE HOME AFTER LONG BLOODY WAR, TOTALLY DEVOID OF EGO-&nbsp; SAMAYAMA VIA THE BACK DOOR.<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">EGO LADEN CRIMINALS ON THE DEATH ROW ALWAYS LOSE 100% EGO IN THE FINAL 24 HOURS .. THEY KNOW THE GAME IS OVER</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">JIVAN MUKTS HAVE ZERO\nEGO.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The PARADOX is that\nsuffering caused by the ego eventually destroys the ego. When ego disappears ,\nbliss enters.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Murderers in the death\nrow have in the last few hours experienced the ego less state and the deep joy\nand peace that comes along with it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even Saddam Hussain\nagreed to wear the black hood on his head without protest before he was hanged\n, in front of several people \u2014under normal circumstances he would have spat on\nthe man who suggested it to him.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Placing your ego on the\nback burner is the first step in realizing one's potential, having a happy\nfamily life and living in harmony with society.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ego thrives\non others and lives on attention . Human ego demands personal recognition and\nwastes energy in resentment if it does not get enough. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The underlying emotion\nfor the ego is fear, the fear of being a nobody.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is always\na sense of insecurity around the ego even if on the outside it appears\nconfident , perfumed and powdered. Ego strengthens itself by diminishing others..</span>\n<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ego is insanity of the\nhuman mind. Unhappiness is an ego created mental cum emotional disease. The\nchatter of the ego continuously disrupts the natural state of well being.\nStress is from within the mind , not by external threat. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ego creates suffering\nwithout recognising it.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many people carry large amount of\nunnecessary baggage, both mental and emotional through out their lives. They\nhang on to the old emotion to strengthen their identity.</span> <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It\u2019s hard to get into\nthe boardrooms and MD offices of some organizations because the egos of the\nleaders take up way too much space. Only bootlickers and hand kissers are\nallowed into their inner sanctum. They recruit yes-men instead of capable men.</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Their\nown agenda is always ahead of the business agenda. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They would disagree\nwith someone\u2019s point just because the is the one who said it. Their ego makes\nthem take everything personally. They mistake a short memory for a clear\nconscience and are miserable within.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They are unable to\nlisten to another person's view without feeling threatened. They leave debris\nand destruction wherever they go. They are very eager to see their picture or\nname on the cover of a business periodical . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Their Indifference\narises due to ego. Their ego cannot distinguish between a situation and their\ninterpretation and reaction to that situation. Cooperation is alien to ego\nexcept when there is a secondary motive. The ego becomes the grit in the system\nthat gets in the way of authentic meaningful communication. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Their self-talk is the\nmouthpiece of ego, Their inflated, overbearing egos create rules for rules\u2019\nsake. They complicate procedures , squash good ideas and keep good people down.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Their ego makes them\nunwilling to admit that they know zilch about a subject in a meeting\u2014the\nequivalent of the ear trying to tell what it saw and tasted and smelt, in a\nbulldozing manner. They brood endlessly on their petty grievances, never held\nbefore them any vision that might have lifted them out of themselves. They\nsubstitute their thinking capabilities with their loud cynical talking\ncapabilities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Compulsive liars are\ndriven by egos feelings of insufficiency.. Ego will force them to make life\ndifficult for others\u2014for they feel the need to put people in their place or get\ninto one-upmanship games.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201c If you want to test a\nman\u2019s character, give him power.\u201d -- Abraham Lincoln.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Such wretched people\nwould give only conditional love to a small child or a kitten.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ego tries to enlarge\nand strengthen by forming gangs and posses. Here the ego has simply shifted\nfrom the personal to the collective.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An immature leader\ndouses the spark of creativity, rather than fan it, for the bottom line is\nalways about him.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your ego can prevent\nyou from being an effective and truly great leader. Ego, popularly conceived as\nan over-inflated sense of self-importance, is a major stumbling block to\neffective leadership. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Good leaders surround\nthemselves with talented, outspoken individuals, not yes- men. Leadership is\nnot an ego game!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ego confuses opinions\nwith facts . Every ego is a master of selective perception and distorted\ninterpretation. Ego likes to judge and be right. You have a problem if you\nallow your ego to supersede your common sense.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ego drives us on to\ngreatness, then thrashes us soundly when we let it get out of control. Ego is a\ndemanding unforgiving parasite . To the ego the present moment NOW hardly\nexists and is always concerned with keeping the past alive. Ego looks at the\npresent with jaundiced eyes of the past. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When people argue they\nwill act as if they are fighting for survival and there is a imminent need to\nwin at all costs. Such is the self delusion caused by ego. The ego thrives on\nreactivity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ego burns up\nconsiderable amounts of energy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People with king sized\negos , when they suddenly fall ill suddenly become nice and gentle and\nhumble\u2014for the hospital is a great leveler.. But alas, when they get better\nenergy returns and so does the ego. Every ego is therefore schizophrenic \u2013 with\nsplit personality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is no ego in\ntelling the waiter that there is a cockroach in your cold soup. To be free of\nego all you need to do is to be aware of your thoughts and emotions as they\nhappen. Awareness and ego cannot coexist. It is difficult to see one's own ego.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a fine line\nbetween pride and arrogance, that line is called EGO. The danger zone is when\nyou start thinking that your accomplishments earn you the right to be\ncondescending, obnoxious and abusive. Arrogance is having an attitude of\nsuperiority, delighting in your own significance and thriving on others\nfeelings of inferiority.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The person with a king\nsized ego, will understand the whole of the planet,, but he will not understand\nwhat his own ego is doing to him. The left brain lobe is the home of his ego.\nIt is the nature of ego to take and that of spirit to give. Since leadership is\nof spirit, the ego powered men can never be good leaders--they can never rise\nover the post of a mangy manager. It is the nature of the right brain lobe, to\nbe accepting and free of judgements. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ego makes a donkey\nthink that he is THE champion race horse.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-zc8CeKcfRWc/WlZRSya7TEI/AAAAAAABX4U/nyfFYXzhW54jQHmfqP88NKkYF1GEslQcgCLcBGAs/s1600/Ei4mages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"149\" data-original-width=\"338\" height=\"282\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-zc8CeKcfRWc/WlZRSya7TEI/AAAAAAABX4U/nyfFYXzhW54jQHmfqP88NKkYF1GEslQcgCLcBGAs/s640/Ei4mages.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanatana Dharma has NOT\nasked young men in the first two ashramas of life to be devoid of ego . The\nfour asramas are: Brahmacharya (student- birth till 25), Grihastha (householder-\n25 to 50 ), Vanaprastha (retired /in retreat 50 to 75) and Sannyasa\n(renunciation 75 till death ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During his student life\na Hindu must have a healthy ego..&nbsp; He\nmusts prepare for his future profession, for his family and society\u2014he must compete\n.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Sanatana Dharma a\nman must compulsorily go through GRIHASTA stage \u2013where he has a wife and\nchildren.&nbsp; He must support his family and\nkeep them happy.&nbsp; During this worldy\nperiod of which pleasure of 5 senses is a part ( Kama ).&nbsp; , Sanatana Dharam supports the pursuit of\nwealth ( artha) as a necessity,&nbsp; within\nlimits , without hedonism , without debauchery under certain defined social and\ncosmic norms<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vanaprastha stage\nbegins when a person's duty as a householder comes to an end: He has become a\ngrandfather, his children are grown up- his children have procreated and have\nbranched out. At this age, he should renounce all physical, material and sexual\npleasures, retire from his social and professional life , and spend major part\nof his time in spiritual matters . He is allowed to take his wife along if he\nleaves his house .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the Sanyasa stage,\nafter the age of 75 till death , the man is supposed to be totally devoted to spirituality\n, taper off his ego , and increasing his soul frequency. He must renounce all\nattachments, desires and responsibilities .&nbsp;\nHe is now solely concerned in lessening his karmic extra baggage and his\nsole concern is to attain moksha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cMidlife is the time to\nlet go of an over-dominant ego and to contemplate the deeper significance of\nhuman existence.\u201d &nbsp;C.G. Jung<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-LFxafXkj0Rc/WlcYpqJfFJI/AAAAAAABX4k/_E8f3e0pLAgRvfw5Y02gmADEltvyQEeJgCLcBGAs/s1600/the-first-half-of-life-is-devoted-to-forming-a-healthy-ego-the-second-half-is5-going-inward-and-quote-1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"720\" data-original-width=\"560\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-LFxafXkj0Rc/WlcYpqJfFJI/AAAAAAABX4k/_E8f3e0pLAgRvfw5Y02gmADEltvyQEeJgCLcBGAs/s640/the-first-half-of-life-is-devoted-to-forming-a-healthy-ego-the-second-half-is5-going-inward-and-quote-1.jpg\" width=\"496\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CONSCIOUS MAN HAS BEEN\nGRANTED FREE WILL BY GOD. SANATANA DHARMA URGES YOU TO AROUSE YOUR INNER VOICE\nAND USE IT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SANATANA DHARMA HAS\nNEVER ASKED A HINDU TO GO AGAINST HIS CONSCIENCE .. DOGMA IS NOT ALLOWED IN\nSANATANA DHARMA STEEPED IN SPIRITUALITY<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">JEW ROTHSCHILD USED HIS\nAGENTS LIKE GANDHI TO SUPPRESS OUR CONSCIENCE .&nbsp;\nGANDHIs AHIMSA WAS PURELY SELECTIVE .. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THIS ROGUE GANDHI IS\nTHIS PLANETs NO 1 RECRUITER OF CIVILIANS FOR VIOLENCE \u2013HE CAN NEVER EVER BE\nSURPASSED.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GANDHI AND NEHRU DID\nNOT GIVE INDIA INDEPENDENCE.. WE THE PEOPLE WRESTED OUR OWN FREEDOM<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">STOP THIS BULLSHIT OF\nGANDHI BEING THE FATHER OF OUR NATION <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/02/the-indian-navy-mutiny-of-1946-only-war.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/02/the-indian-navy-mutiny-of-1946-only-war.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GANDHI TOLD INDIANS TO\nKILL GERMANS WHO DID NO HARM TO BHARATMATA \u2013BUT TO LOVE AND KISS THE WHITE\nBRITISH INVADER, WHO SHAT ON BHARATMATAs FACE , CHAINED HER AND ROBBED HER\nBLIND<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">DOING NOTHING WHEN YOU\nCOULD PREVENT A BAD MAN DOING EXTREME HARM , TO HUMANS, FLORA , FAUNA IS BAD\nKARMA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NOW THEY ARE MAKING A\nLYING MOVIE &nbsp;\u201cTHUGHEES OF HINDOOSTAN\u201d.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THESE\nWERE NOT CRIMINAL MURDERERS.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;THEY WERE PATRIOT HINDUS/ MUSLIMS WHO\nPREVENTED THE WHITE INVADER ( BY GUERILLA WARFARE )&nbsp; FROM CUTTING DOWN HUGE TREES , &nbsp;RAPING OUR FORESTS , AND CARTING AWAY OUR\nNATURAL PRODUCE TO ENGLAND --<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Ajit Vadakayil<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">December 6, 2017 at\n1:55 PM<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">hi td,<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">THUGS OF HINDOSTAN , is\nabout the life of the killer mob (sic ) in India THUGGEE before independence.\n..<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">The film is based on\n19th century novel 'Confession of a Thug'. The book describes about a cult in\nIndia which killed people for money \u2026<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; Political scientist David C. Vrat has been given pride of place in Sanatana Dharma .&nbsp; A pilgrimage to Sabarimala is a VRAT.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/01/sabarimala-makaravilakku-three-light.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/01/sabarimala-makaravilakku-three-light.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white man has\nalways wondered what the hell is this penance and boon stuff you read in Hindu\npuranas.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your energy, translated\ninto thoughts, words, emotions, and deeds, causes all your experiences. We become aware of these impressions\nwhen we practise deep meditation, not superficial meditation. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When we transcend the\nconscious, subconscious and unconscious experiences of personality it is\npossible that initially we become aware of certain traumas that have taken\nplace in our early childhood, ( or past life ) and of which we did not have any\nconscious recollection.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Past life issues that\ncarry into the current life are the result of karma. Samskara is intrinsically\ntied into the laws of karma that govern the cycle of rebirth. Keeping in mind\nthe nature of traumatic imprints and how they cause continual recreation of the\noriginal traumatic event, one can also look at samskaras as trauma imprints\nre-manifested from life to life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most of us are born\nalready with some degree of&nbsp; Post\ntraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) . This is&nbsp;\na debilitating condition that often follows a terrifying physical, life\nthreatening, or perceived as life-threatening, event .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each Samskara has\ninherent in it the capacity to once again recreate that very experience which\noriginally caused it.&nbsp; Our past life\nphysical, emotional and mental bodies are not wiped clean in-between lives, but\ncontinue to recreate themselves in each incarnation through the subtle bodies. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This transmission of\npast physical, emotional and mental wounds constitute a large part of what we\nare meant to heal in our present lives.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this present life we\nhave certain attitudes and imprints within our DNA because of past life\ntraumas.&nbsp; The healing of samskaras and\nimprints is the aim of Past Life Therapy (PLT).&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our past life selves\nlive within us today as sub-personalities. We feel their emotions; manifest\ntheir talents; think their thoughts; are limited by their fears.
