, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern science has\nshown us that the weather few days from today can be known because there are\nsatellites which provide images of cloud formations over the horizon. We can\ncalculate tides centuries in advance .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the same way, man\u2019s\nfuture is always in formation and is visible to the awakened occult eye in the\nhigher planes of consciousness. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A good astrologer can\npoint you in the right direction\u2014he cant take you there .&nbsp; Astrology is NOT pseudo science <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Varahamihira or Mihira muni who was a great\nseer from Kerala wrote astrological books 4700 years ago<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Astrology is pure\nmathematics. in Kerala we have another method called prashnam vekkal -- a\nmethod of delineation of horoscopes using 'cowries' (sea shells) is highly\nvalued for its accuracy. This method works only if the astrologer follows the\nlaws of the universe.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If he east beef ,\ndrinks liquor , screws a whore anally and divines with cowrie shells it wont work.\n.Since antiquity every man in Kerala has had a horoscope written when he was\nborn<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Spirituality teaches\nyou to harness&nbsp; your thoughts, words and\nactions which can even be triggered by your past samskaras .&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You just follow the\nlaws of the universe , and things will fall in place&nbsp;&nbsp; because they are the effect.&nbsp;&nbsp; This may not happen immediately, but it is\ninevitable.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The law of karma is an\nintegral part of spirituality.&nbsp; It gives\nus a basis on which to make right choices and create a beautiful future for\nourselves and the world around us.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma is what WE create\nthrough our deeds, words, thoughts, actions, etc. It is the realm of cause and\neffect.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cremation is symbolic\nof burning negative ego laden samskaras .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Small children less\nthan 27 months age ( who have NOT built an ego \u2013and have not been given a\nchance ) and Jivan Mukts devoid of ego ( who will attain moksha) are buried ,\nNOT burnt<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TODAY IF NEWTON SAW A\nTV REMOTE WORKING ( UNPICKED BY 5 HUMAN SENSES ) HE WILL FIRST SHIT IN HIS\nPANTS AND THEN HE WILL FAINT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TODAY IF MAD MAN\nCHARLES DARWIN SEES DNA PROFILING ( how monika lewinsky trapped bill clinton\nwith a drop of white liquid on her dress) HE WILL GO BERSERK.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The body of the \u201crealized\nman\u201d or Jivan Mukt&nbsp; continues to exist\nuntil his karmas and prarabdhas ( greater responsibility ) has worked itself\nout,&nbsp; and then his mortal coil falls away\non his own free will , and he attains Moksha.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adi Shankaracharya\nattained Moksha at the age of 32 at Kedarnath temple ,&nbsp; after he set up the four Hindu Mutts at\nSringeri, Dwarka, Puri and Badrinath for each of the four Vedas.&nbsp; He also wrote a treatise on the Advaita form\nof Hindusim,&nbsp; before he attained Moksha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AGAIN, BHAKTI YOGA IS\nPOISON INJECTED INTO HINDUSIM BY THE WHITE INVADER<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN SANATANA DHARMA WE\nHAVE ONLY SHRADDHA\u2014NOT BHAKTI<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE FAKE BHAKTI\nMOVEMENT AND ALL ITS FAKE HEROES WERE CREATED AND BACKDATED BY JEW ROTHSCHILD<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanatana Dharma had\nonly Jnana yoga and Karma yoga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Seffless bonafide\ncreative work is KARMA YOGA -- Absolute discernment &nbsp;is Jnana Yoga.. The paths are not generally\nseen as mutually exclusive but complimentary.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma yoga, also called\nKarma marga, is one of the several spiritual paths in Hinduism, one based on\nthe \"yoga of action\".&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red;\"><b>To a karma yogi, right\nwork done well is a form of prayer</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma marga allows an\nethical person who uses his conscience and integrity , to remain within society\ninstead of becoming a renunciant, while also cultivating qualities important in\nthe achievement of salvation. In this path, one acts for the good of society\nwhile pursuing spiritual progress and adhering to standards of correct action.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma Yoga is the path\nof 'action', of putting in 100 percent effort, without being attached to the\noutcome.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma yoga is the path\nof unselfish action. It teaches that a spiritual seeker should act according to\ndharma, without being attached to the fruits or personal consequences. Karma\nYoga, states the Bhagavad Gita\u2014 purifies the mind. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Only dharmic action is\nsuitable in karma yoga, where one downplays one's own exclusive role or one's\nown selfish&nbsp; interests.&nbsp; The karma yogi considers the interests of all\nparties impartially, and then does the right thing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma yoga,&nbsp; does not mean forfeiture of emotions or desires,\nrather it means action driven by \"equanimity, balance\", with\n\"dispassion, disinterest\", avoiding \"one sidedness, fear,\ncraving, favoring self or one group or clan, self-pity, self-aggrandizement or\nany form of extreme reactiveness<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the Bhagavad\nGita, selfless service to the right cause and like-minded others, with the\nright feeling and right attitude, is a form of worship ( <b><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red;\">BHAKTI </span></b>) and\nspirituality<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Verse 3.4 of the\nBhagavad Gita states that avoiding work or not starting work is not the path to\nbecome free of bondage, just like renouncing the world and wearing monk's dress\ndoes not automatically make one spiritual<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Bhagavad Gita,\nKrishna says:--<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tasm\u0101d asakta\u1e25 satata\u1e41\nk\u0101rya\u1e41 karma sam\u0101chara<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">asakto hy\u0101charan karma\nparam \u0101pnoti p\u016bru\u1e63ha\u1e25</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 3.19: Therefore,\ngiving up attachment, perform actions as a matter of duty, for by working\nwithout being attached to the fruits, one attains the Supreme.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma yoga can be\napplied to everything you do: from from the most trivial, ordinary tasks to\ngreater, more challenging works. When action is performed selflessly, with full\nfocus and attention, it brings fulfillment and freedom. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Acting without being\nattached to the fruits of one's deeds \u2013 this alone can lead to union with the\nSelf ( brahman ), which is the goal of yoga....<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma is a crucial\nHindu concept. There can be NO Sanatana Dharma without laws of Karma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the\ndoctrine of karma, our present condition in life is the consequence of the\nactions of our previous lives. The choices we have made in the past directly\naffect our condition in this life, and the choices we make today and thereafter\nwill have consequences for our future lives in samsara.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Karma Yogi should be\nabsolutely free from greed, lust, anger and egoism. Then only he can do real\nuseful service. Even if there are traces of these Doshas, he should try to\nremove them one by one.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma Yoga prepares the\nmind for the reception of Light or Knowledge. It expands the heart and breaks\nall barriers that stand in the way of unity or oneness. Karma Yoga is the\neffective Sadhana for Chitta Suddhi ( purity of mind ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chitta Suddhi comes\nthrough Nishkam Karma&nbsp; Yoga.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To\ndo Nishkamya Karma, you must have controlled the Indriyas. The Indriyas can be\ncontrolled through Viveka and Vairagya.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nishkam Karma&nbsp; self-less or desireless action, is an action\nperformed without any expectation of fruits or results, and the central tenet\nof Karma Yoga path to liberation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">God can even give you\ndivine exemption and dispensation for balance negative karmic baggage if your\ngood karma in present life ,&nbsp; involves\ngreat personal sacrifice without caring for selfish personal FAAYADA ( Sakam\nKarma - attached involvement)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Work elevates when done\nin the right spirit without attachment or egoism.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">karma\u1e47y-ev\u0101dhik\u0101ras te\nm\u0101 phale\u1e63hu kad\u0101chana<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">m\u0101 karma-phala-hetur\nbh\u016br m\u0101 te sa\u1e45go \u2019stvakarma\u1e47i<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 2.47: You have a\nright to perform your prescribed duties, but you are not entitled to the fruits\nof your actions. Never consider yourself to be the cause of the results of your\nactivities, nor be attached to inaction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Action alone hast thou\na right and never at all to its fruits; let not the fruits of action be thy\nmotive; neither let there be in thee any attachment to inaction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">k\u0101yena manas\u0101 buddhy\u0101\nkevalair indriyair api<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">yogina\u1e25 karma kurvanti\nsa\u1e45ga\u1e41 tyaktv\u0101tma-\u015bhuddhaye<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 5.11: The yogis,\nwhile giving up attachment, perform actions with their body, senses, mind, and\nintellect, only for the purpose of self-purification.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With the body, with the\nmind, with the intellect, even merely with the senses, the Yogis perform action\ntoward self-purification, having abandoned attachment. He who is disciplined in\nYoga, having abandoned the fruit of action, attains steady peace...<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">yoga-stha\u1e25 kuru karm\u0101\u1e47i\nsa\u1e45ga\u1e41 tyaktv\u0101 dhana\u00f1jaya<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">siddhy-asiddhyo\u1e25 samo\nbh\u016btv\u0101 samatva\u1e41 yoga uchyate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 2.48: Be steadfast\nin the performance of your duty, O Arjun, abandoning attachment to success and\nfailure. Such equanimity is called Yog.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fixed in yoga, do thy\nwork, O Winner of wealth (Arjuna), abandoning attachment, with an even mind in\nsuccess and failure, for evenness of mind is called yoga<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nishkamya karma refers\nto the works performed without any motive or desire for a result or fear of\nconsequence. It entails selfless service ( creative ), or seva, without the\nexpectation of thanks or reward.&nbsp; Lack of\ngreed and selfishness&nbsp; is key to the\nKarma yoga path to enlightenment and liberation \u2013by lessening negative karmic\nbaggage .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">na hi j\u00f1\u0101nena sad\u1e5bi\u015bha\u1e41\npavitramiha vidyate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tatsvaya\u1e41 yogasansiddha\u1e25\nk\u0101len\u0101tmani vindati<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 4.38: In this world,\nthere is nothing as purifying as divine knowledge. One who has attained purity\nof mind through prolonged practice of Yog, receives such knowledge within the\nheart, in due course of time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Karma Yogi realises\nfor himself the Atma Jnana in the course of time..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">yukta\u1e25 karma-phala\u1e41\ntyaktv\u0101 \u015bh\u0101ntim \u0101pnoti nai\u1e63h\u1e6dhik\u012bm<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ayukta\u1e25 k\u0101ma-k\u0101re\u1e47a\nphale sakto nibadhyate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 5.12: Offering the\nresults of all activities to God, the karm yogis attain everlasting peace.\nWhereas those who, being impelled by their desires, work with a selfish motive\nbecome entangled because they are attached to the fruits of their actions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Karma Yogi, having\nabandoned the fruit of action, obtains eternal peace or release which comes of\nwisdom, while, he who, being prompted by desire, is attached to them, becomes\nbound.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lord Krishna says:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tasm\u0101t sarve\u1e63hu k\u0101le\u1e63hu\nm\u0101m anusmara yudhya cha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">mayyarpita-mano-buddhir\nm\u0101m evai\u1e63hyasyasan\u015bhayam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 8.7: Therefore,\nalways remember me and also do your duty of fighting the war. With mind and\nintellect surrendered to me, you will definitely attain me; of this, there is\nno doubt.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The yogi who practices\nnishkamya karma is freed from the three karmas of prarbdha (present actions),\nsanchita (all past actions) and agami (future actions that result from the\npresent) because he acts without egoism. As a result, the yogi is freed through\nthis detachment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The path of Karma Yoga\neventually leads to the attainment of Moksha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u015bhrey\u0101n dravya-may\u0101d\nyaj\u00f1\u0101j j\u00f1\u0101na-yaj\u00f1a\u1e25 parantapa<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">sarva\u1e41 karm\u0101khila\u1e41\np\u0101rtha j\u00f1\u0101ne parisam\u0101pyate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 4.33: O subduer of\nenemies, sacrifice performed in knowledge is superior to any mechanical\nmaterial sacrifice. After all, O Parth, all sacrifices of work culminate in\nwisdom<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Moksha is the summum\nbonum of life. Moksha is the fulfilment of life's purpose. Life ends on this\nearth plane when you attain Moksha or liberation from birth and death<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Karma Yogi should be\nabsolutely free from lust, greed, anger and egoism. Even if there are traces of\nthese Doshas, he should try to remove them. He should have power of endurance.\nHe should have absolute faith in himself, in God<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Karma Yogi should\nhave a sound, healthy and strong physical body\u2014and must have courage . He\nshould be ever ready to sacrifice his body for a noble cause , incuding\nprotecting his motherland . If a woman is getting molested on the street a\nKarma yogi will be the first to interfere<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A timid man is\nabsolutely unfit for Karma Yoga. He is fit to assist his wife in cleaning\nutensils in the kitchen in the morning and in washing her stained\nunderwear&nbsp; in the evening.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u012b\u015bhvara\u1e25 sarva-bh\u016bt\u0101n\u0101\u1e41\nh\u1e5bid-de\u015bhe \u2018rjuna ti\u1e63h\u1e6dhati<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">bhr\u0101mayan sarva-bh\u016bt\u0101ni\nyantr\u0101r\u016b\u1e0dh\u0101ni m\u0101yay\u0101<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 18.61: The Supreme\nLord dwells in the hearts of all living beings, O Arjun. According to their\nkarmas, he directs the wanderings of the souls, who are seated on a machine\nmade of the material energy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PRAYER FOR A HINDU --IF\nTO UNLEASH THE POWER GRATITUDE. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">EVERY VEDIC SRUTI HAS\nGRATITUDE IN ITS WARP AND WEFT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GRATITUDE IS A KEY\nWHICH UNLOCKS HIDDEN POTENTIAL<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHEN YOU HAVE A FEELING\nOF GRATITUDE YOU CAN CURE YOURSELF AND OTHERS--AS YOUR DNA GENERATES SCALAR\nWAVES<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">REPLACE FEAR WITH\nGRATITUDE -- AS A NEW YEAR RESOLUTION<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Karma Yogi does not\nexpect even a return of love, appreciation, gratitude or admiration from the\npeople whom he is serving.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma Yoga gives Chitta\nSuddhi. It purifies the heart and prepares the mind for the dawn of knowledge\n(Jnana Udaya).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Only he who has reduced\nhis wants and controlled his Indriyas can do Karma Yoga. How can a man of\nluxury, with his Indriyas revolting, serve others? He wants everything for\nhimself, and wants to exploit and domineer over others. Another qualification\nis that he must have a balanced mind. He must be free from Raga-Dvesha (likes\nand dislikes) also.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">niyata\u1e41 sa\u1e45ga-rahitam\nar\u0101ga-dve\u1e63hata\u1e25 k\u1e5bitam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">aphala-prepsun\u0101 karma\nyat tat s\u0101ttvikam uchyate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 18.23: Action that\nis in accordance with the scriptures, which is free from attachment and\naversion, and which is done without desire for rewards, is in the mode of\ngoodness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Action which is ordained, done by one who is\nundesirous of fruit, devoid of attachment, without love or hate\u2014that is called\npure.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Merit and demerit,\nPunya and Papa, do not affect that Karma Yogi who has evenness or equanimity of\nmind, for he exults not over the good fruit of the one nor worries over the bad\nfruit of the other. He has equanimity of mind in success and failure. His mind\nis always resting in God all the while<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Karma Yogi has no\nattachment to sensual objects. He has purified his mind by constant selfless\nservice. He has given up all idea of agency. He treats the body as an\ninstrument of God, given to him for the fulfilment of His purpose. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He attributes all\nactivities to the Divine Actor within. He who is established in the Yoga of\nequanimity becomes an expert in the science of Karma Yoga. That is the reason\nwhy Lord Krishna says:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">buddhi-yukto jah\u0101t\u012bha\nubhe suk\u1e5bita-du\u1e63hk\u1e5bite<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tasm\u0101d yog\u0101ya yujyasva\nyoga\u1e25 karmasu kau\u015bhalam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 2.50: One who\nprudently practices the science of work without attachment can get rid of both\ngood and bad reactions in this life itself. Therefore, strive for Yog, which is\nthe art of working skillfully (in proper consciousness).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">United to the pure\nreason, one abandoneth here both good and evil deeds: therefore cleave thou to\nYoga; Yoga is skill in action.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Karma Yogi who\npossesses evenness of mind casts off the fruits of actions. He escapes from\ngood and bad births. Clinging to fruit only is the cause of rebirth. When all\nactions are performed for God\u2019s sake in fulfilment of His purpose without\ndesire for fruit, the Karma Yogi gets illumination. He shakes off the bondage\nof birth. He attains knowledge of Brahman and through Brahma Jnana, liberation\nor Moksha. In the Gita you will find:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">karma-ja\u1e41 buddhi-yukt\u0101\nhi phala\u1e41 tyaktv\u0101 man\u012b\u1e63hi\u1e47a\u1e25<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">janma-bandha-vinirmukt\u0101\u1e25\npada\u1e41 gachchhanty-an\u0101mayam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 2.51: The wise\nendowed with equanimity of intellect, abandon attachment to the fruits of\nactions, which bind one to the cycle of life and death. By working in such\nconsciousness, they attain the state beyond all suffering.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sages, united to\nthe pure reason, renounce the fruit which action yieldeth, and, liberated from\nthe bonds of birth, they go to the blissful seat</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Nishkamya Karma Yogi\nsays: \u201cDo all works without expectation of fruits. This will produce Chitta\nSuddhi. Then you will get knowledge of the Self. You will get Moksha or eternal\nbliss, peace and immortality.\u201d This is his doctrine. That is the reason why Lord\nKrishna says to Arjuna:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">karma\u1e47y-ev\u0101dhik\u0101ras te\nm\u0101 phale\u1e63hu kad\u0101chana<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">m\u0101 karma-phala-hetur\nbh\u016br m\u0101 te sa\u1e45go \u2019stvakarma\u1e47i<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 2.47: You have a\nright to perform your prescribed duties, but you are not entitled to the fruits\nof your actions. Never consider yourself to be the cause of the results of your\nactivities, nor be attached to inaction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thy business is with\nthe action only, never with its fruits; so let not the fruits of action be thy\nmotive, nor be thou to inaction attached.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">neh\u0101bhikrama-n\u0101\u015bho \u2019sti\npratyav\u0101yo na vidyate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">svalpam apyasya\ndharmasya tr\u0101yate mahato bhay\u0101t<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 2.40: Working in\nthis state of consciousness, there is no loss or adverse result, and even a\nlittle effort saves one from great danger.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is no loss of\neffort here, there is no harm. Even a little of this service delivers one from\ngreat fear.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The path of Karma Yoga,\nwhich eventually leads to the attainment of the infinite bliss of the Self,\ncannot be futile.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Attachment is the first\nchild of Maya. Selfishness causes attachment. Wherever there is attachment\nthere are Ahamta and Mamata\u2014\u2018I-ness\u2019 and \u2018mine-ness\u2019. The whole Mayaic Chakra\nhas begun to revolve. The man has become a slave now. Strong iron chains are\nfastened to his hands, knees and legs. He has entangled himself like a spider\nor the silk-worm. This is his own self-created trouble through attachment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karmas are good or, bad\n<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The results of good\nKarmas are:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(1) Purification of the\nmind, that is to say, the removal from the mind of its drossness which is the\neffect of thoughts of narrow selfishness and gross sensuality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(2) Happiness in the\nhigher regions, during the period between the death and rebirth in this\nphysical world. If the Karma is of an exceptional nature, the thinker may even\nbe made an office-bearer with an authority in such higher regions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(3) Coming back, as man\nagain, to earth-life with facilities for further purification of mind. If the\nKarma, however, is done without attachment to its fruits and the thinker has\nbeen going along the path of Jnana (knowledge) or along the higher regions of\nthe path of Bhakti (devotion to the supreme universal Soul) having his mind\ncompletely purified and possessing faith in the revealed truth that he and the\nDivine Object of his devotion are in fact one in the self, he is not bound to\nreturn again to earth-life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The results of bad\nKarmas are:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(1) The mind becomes\nmore and more impure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(2) Suffering in the\nnether region or hell during the period between the death and rebirth here.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(3) If the Karma is\nvery bad, after suffering in the nether region, the thinker is made to take his\nbirth in this world in the lower animal or vegetable kingdom as part of his\npunishment. In some cases these lower births immediately follow the previous earth-life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(4) After undergoing\nhis sufferings in hell or as a sub-human Jiva, the thinker comes again to\nassume a human body. He is then placed amidst very unfavourable environments to\nhis progress onwards. These bad environments or impediments to advancement are\nin consequence of his own previous errors and misdoings.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">api ched asi p\u0101pebhya\u1e25\nsarvebhya\u1e25 p\u0101pa-k\u1e5bit-tama\u1e25<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">sarva\u1e41 j\u00f1\u0101na-plavenaiva\nv\u1e5bijina\u1e41 santari\u1e63hyasi<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 4.36: Even those who\nare considered the most immoral of all sinners can cross over this ocean of\nmaterial existence by seating themselves in the boat of divine knowledge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">yathaidh\u0101nsi samiddho\n\u2019gnir bhasma-s\u0101t kurute \u2019rjuna<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">j\u00f1\u0101n\u0101gni\u1e25 sarva-karm\u0101\u1e47i\nbhasma-s\u0101t kurute tath\u0101<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 4.37: As a kindled\nfire reduces wood to ashes, O Arjun, so does the fire of knowledge burn to\nashes all reactions from material activities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">na hi j\u00f1\u0101nena sad\u1e5bi\u015bha\u1e41\npavitramiha vidyate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tatsvaya\u1e41 yogasansiddha\u1e25\nk\u0101len\u0101tmani vindati<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 4.38: In this world,\nthere is nothing as purifying as divine knowledge. One who has attained purity\nof mind through prolonged practice of Yog, receives such knowledge within the\nheart, in due course of time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even if thou art the\nmost sinful of all sinners, yet shall thou cross over all sin by the raft of\nwisdom. As the burning fire reduces fuel to ashes, O Arjuna, so doth the fire\nof wisdom reduce all action to ashes. Verily, there is no purifier in this\nworld like wisdom; he that is perfected in Yoga finds it in the Self in due\nseason.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;A WISE HINDU PRAYS TO GOD WHEN HE KNOWS HIS\nLAST MOMENTS ON PLANET EARTH HAVE ARRIVED<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The last powerful\nthought that occupies the mind of a man in his dying moment determines the\nnature of his next birth. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ya\u1e41 ya\u1e41 v\u0101pi smaran\nbh\u0101va\u1e41 tyajatyante kalevaram<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ta\u1e41 tam evaiti kaunteya\nsad\u0101 tad-bh\u0101va-bh\u0101vita\u1e25<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 8.6: Whatever one\nremembers upon giving up the body at the time of death, O son of Kunti, one\nattains that state, being always absorbed in such contemplation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whosoever at the end\nabandoneth the body, thinking upon any being, to that being only he goeth, O\nKaunteya, ever to that confirmed by nature.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma is QUANTUM energy\nwhich an embodied being generates\u2014be it vital, mental or moral\u2014and which keeps\nhim in the mundane world, the Samsara. Karma, in short, is the whole Samsaric\nmake-up of an embodied being<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma refers to the\ntotality of our actions and their concomitant reactions in this and previous\nlives, all of which determines our future.&nbsp;\nIt is the interplay between our experience and how we respond to it that\nmakes karma devastating or helpfully invigorating.&nbsp; The conquest of karma lies in intelligent\naction and dispassionate reaction.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Not all karmas rebound\nimmediately.&nbsp; Some accumulate and return unexpectedly\nin this or other births.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ultimate reward is\nrelease from samsara and union with God.&nbsp;\nSamsara represents the cycle of life, death, and rebirth in which a\nperson carries his or her own karma.&nbsp;\nEach life cycle presents an opportunity for redressal and balance.&nbsp; \u201c You reap what you sow\" mirrors the\nHindu concept of karma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just because a fake\nsaint deceived everbody claiming to be a videha , and his followers buried him\nin meditative pose, he will NOT attain moksha. Rather he will pay dearly for\nhis deceit.&nbsp; Emancipation during one's\nlife time is Jivanmukti while the same after death is Videhamukti.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India a known Jivan\nmukta, is above the law of the land meant for wordly humans.&nbsp; The large hearted and virtuous liberated sage\nhas separated himself from the mind.&nbsp; He\nis just a witness of the mind.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Rig Veda Jew\nRothschild has injected an invocation to be made to Chitragupta before making a\nANIMAL SACRIFICE. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sorry , there is NO\nanimal sacrifice in Hindusim. it was started by Rothschild\u2019s FAKE mutts<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/11/all-animal-sacrifices-in-hindu-temples.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/11/all-animal-sacrifices-in-hindu-temples.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rothschild got a temple\nat Alwar dedicated to Chitra gupta.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The FAKE kanchi mutt\ngot a temple for chitra gupta in kanchipuram.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CHITRA GUPTA FOLLOWERS\nARE HAPPILY EATING BEEF -- A LOOP HOLE PROVIDED BY ROTHSCHILD .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me break a\nbombshell--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">KAYASTHA was almost\nlike a SIR knighthood , if Hindus toed the R line.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are many famous\nkayasthas who were stooges of the white invader.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SIR Herbert Hope Risley\nunder orders from Rothschild tried to get the Kayasthas to BURY their dead like\nthe VEERA SHAIVA LINGAYATHS .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kayasthas were not\nCHOOTS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is only ONE\nsingle condition in Sanatana Dharma-- YOU MUST CREMATE THE DEAD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you intended to be\ncremated after death and you doron at sea\u2014your soul up can be shot up to a\nsuitable astral layer by a wellwisher breaking a coconut with INTENTION<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you do that -- it\ndoes NOT even matter you were an atheist while you lived.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SINCE ADI SHANKARACHARYA\nIN 2000 BC , NO HINDU HAS UNDERSTOOD SANATANA DHARMA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">YOU ARE GIVEN CHANCES\nTO LESSEN YOUR KARMIC BAGGAGE ONCE YOU BECOME HUMAN. THIS IS WHY GOD HAS GIVEN\nYOU FREE WILL.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma symbols such as\nendless knot (above) are common cultural motifs in Asia. Endless knots\nsymbolize interlinking of cause and effect, a Karmic cycle that continues\neternally. The endless knot is visible in the center of the prayer wheel.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A good action creates\ngood karma, as does good intent. A bad action creates bad karma, as does bad\nintent<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lotus symbolically\nrepresents karma. A blooming lotus flower is one of the few flowers that\nsimultaneously carries seeds inside itself while it blooms. Seed is\nsymbolically seen as cause, the flower effect. Lotus is also considered as a\nreminder that one can grow, share good karma and remain unstained even in muddy\ncircumstances<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Disinterested actions,\nor unintentional actions do not have the same positive or negative karmic\neffect, as interested and intentional actions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus good karma produces\ngood effect on the actor, while bad karma produces bad effect. The effect of\nkarma need not be immediate; the effect of karma can be later in one's current\nlife,&nbsp; it extends to future lives.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The consequence or\neffects of one's karma can be described in two forms: phalas and samskaras. A\nphala (literally, fruit or result) is the visible or invisible effect that is\ntypically immediate or within the current life. In contrast, samskaras are invisible\neffects, produced inside the actor because of the karma, transforming the agent\nand affecting his or her ability to be happy or unhappy in this life and future\nones. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma seeds habits\n(vasana), and habits create the nature of man. Karma also seeds self\nperception, and perception influences how one experiences life events. Both\nhabits and self perception affect the course of one's life. Breaking bad habits\nis not easy: it requires conscious karmic effort.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Karma is not itself \"reward and\npunishment\", but the law that produces consequence.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma theory considers\nnot only the action, but also actor's intentions, attitude, and desires before\nand during the action. The karma concept thus encourages each person to seek\nand live a moral life, as well as avoid an immoral life. The meaning and\nsignificance of karma is thus as a building block of an ethical theory.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c7873256493117490135\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_148M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/04/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_15.html?showComment=1523888707577#c64275713178922780\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">April 16, 2018 at 7:55 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_147MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1--<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nJEW ROTHSCHILD INTRODUCED \"BRAHMACHARYA \" (CELIBACY ) AND WE HAVE HIS AGENT FREEMASON ROGUES LIKE VIVEKANANDA MAKING A VIRTUE OUT OF IT..<br />\n<br />\nBrahmacharya has nothing to do with withholding semen. The celibate transforms the energy of reproduction into spiritual energy (ojas), bringing in lustre.<br />\n<br />\nThe word \u2018virya\u2019 mentioned means power of knowledge or action, vigor in body\u2019s organs and the mind, spiritual power or the attainment of siddhis.<br />\n<br />\nBrahmacharya is about allocation: using your resources effectively to achieve your aspiration.Brahmacharya means not misusing sex. Brahmacharya means \u2018to respect the creative power of sex and not abuse it by manipulating others sexually.<br />\n<br />\nThe sex you have with your wife is LOVE. The sex you have with a whore is LUST.<br />\n<br />\nLike the other yamas, brahmacharya has to do with balance, and how we choose to use or \u201cinvest\u201d our resources. Each and every act and thought is an outflow of energy.<br />\n<br />\nBrahmacharya is about harnessing the energy or power of our senses and directing that instead to greater personal understanding- not withholding semen.<br />\n<br />\nWE ARE DONE WITH HOMOSEXUALITY SPREADING GURUS LIKE SRI SRI RAVISHANKAR AND SADGURU JAGGI VASUDEV..<br />\n<br />\nROTHSCHILD USED GANDHI TO SPEAD HIS BRAHMACHARI NONSENSE-- ALL THE WHILE GANDHI WAS SLEEPING NAKED WITH UNDERAGE GIRLS.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/01/mahatma-gandhi-and-his-endless.html</span><br />\n<br />\nThe technical meaning of Brahmacharya is self-restraint, particularly mastery of perfect control over the senses- not the PRICK or DICK or LODA alone.</div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Brahmacharya is the virtue of celibacy when unmarried and fidelity when married..</span></div>\n<br />\nBrahmacharya is a means, not an end. It usually includes cleanliness, ahimsa, simple living, studies, meditation, and voluntary restraints on certain foods, intoxicants, and behaviors-(including sexual behavior).<br />\nTHIS BLOGSITE AND WE THE PEOPLE HAVE 100% SYMPATHY FOR TRENSGENDERS ( HIJRAS )\u2026BUT WE HAVE NO SYMPATHY FOR GAYS AND LESBIANS WHO ARE 99% PEDOPHILES..<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\">IT IS A CRIME TO CLUB TRANSGENDERS WITH GAY AND LESBIAN PERVERTS \u2026</span></b><br />\nOnce a train ticket inspector tried to harass one of my wife\u2019s relatives who was travelling alone at night\u2026 She had the ticket but was in the wrong railway line\u2026 ( this had happened to me and I know ) Three hijras piled on to him so badly that the fellow had to run away at the next station.. These hijras then escorted the woman till her home front door..and they expected nothing in return..<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_148b+seedaHXD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_148b+seedaHXD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5220383658955736449\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_191M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt.
