The best day to fast are\nekadashi, the 11th day of the waxing and waning moon. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For one with a well\nbalanced body and mind, that shift of nostril dominance happens automatically\napproximately once in ninety minutes. For other people, the shift may be much\ndifferent. Sometimes one can be so off balance that one nostril remains\ndominant, which is a symptom of some physical, mental, or emotional\ndifficulties.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/11/pranayama-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/11/pranayama-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pranayama is a divinely\nrevealed science that improves health, increases vitality, and awakens the\nlatent spiritual energies in the subtle body. Combined with asanas, meditation,\njapa, prayer and devotion, pranayama can quicken our spiritual advancement. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The renowned Hatha-Yoga\nmaster B. K. S. Iyengar has explained the connection between breath control and\nthe elements as follows:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In our body we have\nfive elements. The element responsible for production of the elixir of life\n(prana) is earth. The element of air is used as a churning rod, through\ninhalation and exhalation, and distribution is through the element of ether.\nEther is space, and its quality is that it can contract or expand. When you\ninhale, the element of ether expands to take the breath in. In exhalation, the\nether contracts to push out toxins.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Two elements remain:\nwater and fire. If there is a fire, water is used to extinguish it. This gives\nus the idea that fire and water are opposing elements. With the help of the\nelements of earth, air and ether, a friction is created between water and fire,\nwhich not only generates energy but releases it, just as water moving turbines\nin a hydroelectric power station produces electricity. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To generate\nelectricity, the water has to flow at a certain speed. An inadequate flow will\nnot produce electricity. Similarly, in our system, normal breathing does not\nproduce that intense energy. This is why we are all suffering from stress and\nstrain, causing poor circulation which affects our health and happiness. The\ncurrent is not sufficient so we are merely existing, not living.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the practice of\npranayama, we make the breath very long. In this way, the elements of fire and\nwater are brought together, and this contact of fire and water in the body,\nwith the help of the element of air, releases a new energy, called by yogis\ndivine energy, or kundalini shakti, and this is the energy of prana.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the\nShiva-Samhita(3.26-28), alternate breathing should be performed twenty times\nfour times a day-at dawn, mid-day, sunset, and mid-night. If done regularly for\nthree months, this procedure, we are told, will definitely cleanse the\nchannels. It is only then that the practitioner should turn to breath control\nproper.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An indirect method of\nawakening the Kundalini for amazing results adopted by Indian yogis is tapasya,\nwhich means the performance of severe penances and austerities. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These yogis do NO wear\nclothes and cover themselves with ashes.&nbsp;\nTapasya&nbsp;&nbsp; is&nbsp;&nbsp; a&nbsp;&nbsp;\nmeans&nbsp;&nbsp; of&nbsp;&nbsp; purification. Through this process the mind,\nthe emotions and the whole personality are cleansed of all the dirt, complexes\nand patterns of behavior that cause pain and suffering.&nbsp; Bad habits, vices are uprooted and destroyed\nat its psychic root,&nbsp; not only at the\nconscious level. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tapasya is a\npsychological or psycho-emotional process through which the aspirant tries&nbsp;&nbsp; to&nbsp;&nbsp;\nset&nbsp;&nbsp; in&nbsp;&nbsp; motion&nbsp;&nbsp;\na&nbsp;&nbsp; process&nbsp;&nbsp; of&nbsp;&nbsp;\nmetabolism&nbsp;&nbsp; that&nbsp;&nbsp; will&nbsp;&nbsp;\neradicate&nbsp;&nbsp; the&nbsp;&nbsp; habits&nbsp;&nbsp;\nthat&nbsp;&nbsp; create weakness and\nobstruct the awakening of willpower.&nbsp;\nThis strength of will is the fruit of tapasya.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once you achieve a\nbalanced mind in the face of mental and emotional conflicts and you can endure\nanger, worry, love and passion, disappointment, jealousy, hatred, memories of\nthe past, sufferings and sorrows, you are ready for the awakening.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Such sadhus live in\nseclusion because when there are interactions with people, so many thought\ncurrents move in the mind.&nbsp; Mixing with\npeople, talking and gossiping create crosscurrents of love, hatred,\ninfatuation, jealousy, likes and dislikes, restlessness, worry , desires and\npassions. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you do NOT have\nany interaction with people, you will be spared a lot of mental turmoil.&nbsp; You will&nbsp;\nhave NIL psychological cobwebs.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He is also ready for\nthe vairagya or detachment that will come to him as a result of the awakening\nof kundalini.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These yogis\npractice&nbsp; Hatha-Yoga. The\nGheranda-Samhita (5.36) distinguishes between two basic types of purification\npractices: samanu and nirmanu, which terms denote \"mental\" and\n\"nonmental\" respectively. I will discuss the latter first.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As this text explains,\nit consists in physical cleansing processes called dhauti, comprising the\nfollowing techniques:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. antar-dhauti\n(\"inner cleansing\") consisting of the following four techniques:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(a) vata-sara\n(\"air process\"), which is done by inhaling through the mouth and\nexpelling the air through the lower passage;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(b) vari-sara\n(\"water process\"), which is done by sipping water until the stomach\nis completely filled and expelling it through the lower passage;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(c) vahni-sara\n(\"fire process\"), which is done by pushing the navel one hundred\ntimes back toward the spine, which increased the \"gastric fire\";<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(d) bahish-krita\n(\"external action\"), which is done by sucking in air through the\nmouth until the stomach is filled, retaining it for ninety minutes, and then\nexpelling it through the lower passage; this is followed by one's standing in\nnavel-deep water and pushing out the lower intestinal tract for cleansing\u2014I do\nhope you understand what this means.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. danta-dhauti\n(\"dental cleansing\"), which includes cleaning the teeth, the tongue,\nas well as the ears and frontal sinuses;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. hrid-dhauti\n(\"lit. \"heart cleansing\"), which consists of (a) introducing the\nstalk of a plantain, turmeric, or cane into the throat to clean it out; (b)\nfilling the stomach with water and then expelling it through the mouth; (c)\nswallowing a long strip of thin cloth and then pulling it out again (a process\ncalled v\u0432so-dhauti, \"cloth cleansing\");<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. mula-shodhana\n(\"rectal cleansing\"), which is done by means of turmeric, water, or\nthe middle finger.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blissful sex or\ndrinking Soma and raising Kundalini in 3 seconds would have been much easier ,\nright?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Shiva-Samhita\n(3.31-32) also states that when the nadis have been purified, certain signs\nwill manifest: The body becomes harmonious (sama) and beautiful, and emits a\npleasant scent, while the voice becomes resonant and the appetite increases.\nAlso, the yogin whose subtle pathways are thoroughly cleansed is always\n\"full-hearted,\" energetic, and strong.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nHatha-Yoga-Prad\u043epika (2.19) mentions leanness and brightness of the body as\nindications of a purified nadi system. Now the practitioner is like a finely\ntuned instrument and ready to engage the higher processes of Tantra, leading to\nthe activation of the serpent power.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The psychic symbol for\nmooladhara Chakra is a deep red, four-petalled lotus.&nbsp; Inside there is a smoky lingam around which a\nsnake is coiled three and a half times with its head facing in a dormant or\nsleeping state. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On each petal is a\nletter: vam, sham, sham, sam, written in gold. In the pericarp is a yellow\nsquare, symbol of the earth element, surrounded by eight golden spears - four\nat each corner and four at the cardinal points. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In tantra this coiled\nserpent is known as mahakala, great or endless time. Here kundalini is lying in\nthe womb of the unconscious, beyond time and space. When kundalini begins to\nmanifest, it enters the dimensions of personality and individuality, and\nbecomes subject to time and space.&nbsp; That\nis the awakening of the great serpent power within the individual form, frame\nand consciousness of the human being. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, inmost people\nit is dormant. In its awakened state kundaiini shakti represents our spiritual\npotential, but in its dormant state it represents that instinctive level of\nlife which supports our basic existence Mooladhara awakening is often accompanied\nby itchy sensations around the coccyx or anus, and the sense of smell becomes\nso acute that offensive odors are difficult to bear. When the positive and\nnegative forces of ida and pingala are completely balanced, an awakening is\nsparked off here which arouses the dormant kundalini.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the female body its\nlocation is at the root of the uterus, in the posterior side of the cervix&nbsp; Mooladhara is the first center in human\nincarnation, but it is the highest chakra that animals have the capacity to awaken.&nbsp; It is their sahasrara. The higher chakras\nbeyond mooladhara are not present in the psychic physiology of animals and\ntheir nervous systems reflect this relative deficiency. I wonder of Charles\nDarwrin ever knew of consciousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Below mooladhara there\nare other chakras which represent the evolution of the animal kingdom. They are\nonly related to sense consciousness and not to mental awareness The names of\nthe lower chakras are atala, vitala, sutala, talatala, rasatala, mahatala\nand&nbsp;&nbsp; the&nbsp;&nbsp; lowest&nbsp;&nbsp;\nis patala. Just as mooladhara is the lowest chakra in the human body,\npatala is the lowest in the animal kingdom. It is the dimension which\nrepresents total darkness, where nature is not functioning and matter is\ncompletely dormant and static.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sahasrara is the\nhighest in human evolution.&nbsp; Up to\nmooladhara chakra evolution takes place automatically. Animals do not have to\npractise pranayama and japa yoga Because they don't think, nature is\nbenevolently responsible for every phase of their evolution. However, once\nkundalini reaches mooladhara chakra, evolution is no longer spontaneous,\nbecause a human being is not completely subjected to the laws of nature. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, animals\nonly mate in particular seasons. At other times, even if they live together\nthey will not mate. But, because man is free from the laws of nature, he can\nmate whenever he wants. Conscious creatures can see themselves in the\nmirror\u2014only humans and elephants can do that. Few creatures like chimps,\nbonobos and dolphins are partially conscious. This is why dolphins and bonobos\nhave sex for pleasure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Man has awareness of\ntime and space, and he has an ego. He can think, he can know that he is\nthinking and he can know that he knows that he is thinking. This is because of\nthe evolution of ego. If there is no ego there will not be double awareness.\nAnimals do not have double awareness. If a dog is chasing another dog, it is\nunder nature's compulsion. It doesn't know it is chasing and the other dog\ndoesn't know that it is running. It runs because instinct compels it to. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That is why it is said\nthat kundalini is sleeping in mooladhara chakra. It can't progress beyond this\npoint unless it is pushed and prodded . Sometimes it even ascends to\nswadhisthana or manipura via ida or pingala nadis to find it blocked only get\nangry attack these centres and to return to mooladhara again to sleep. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, once the\nshakti goes beyond manipura chakra via sushumna nadi there is no going back. It\nis the inner aspect of that nerve complex which carries all kinds of sensations\nand is immediately connected with the testes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In both the male and\nfemale bodies, there is a vestigial gland at mooladhara chakra which is\nsomething like a knot.&nbsp; In Sanskrit this\nis known as brahma granthi; the knot of Brahma. As long as this knot remains\nintact, the energy located in this area is blocked. But the moment the knot is\nopened, shakti awakens. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is only when the\nindividual awakens to the possibility of divine consciousness, to a greater\nforce and purpose than that of instinctive animal life, that the brahma granthi\nbegins to loosen. Consciousness begins to be liberated from the root center as\nthe individual's aspiration awakens. Just because mooladhara is situated near\nyour asshole , this does not make it an impure center.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All&nbsp;&nbsp; the&nbsp;&nbsp;\npassions&nbsp;&nbsp; are&nbsp;&nbsp; stored&nbsp;&nbsp;\ninmooladhara, all the guilt, every complex and every agony has its root\nin mooladhara chakra.&nbsp; Man's life, his\ndesires, his actions and his accomplishments, are controlled by the sexual&nbsp;&nbsp; desires,&nbsp;&nbsp;\nand&nbsp;&nbsp; whatever&nbsp;&nbsp; we&nbsp;&nbsp;\ndo&nbsp;&nbsp; in&nbsp;&nbsp; life&nbsp;&nbsp;\nis&nbsp;&nbsp; an&nbsp;&nbsp; expression&nbsp;&nbsp;\nof&nbsp;&nbsp; that&nbsp;&nbsp; lower&nbsp;&nbsp;\nchakra . Our lower samskaras and karmas are embedded there, as in lower\nincarnations, one's whole being is founded on the sexual personality.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When mooladhara awakens,\na number of phenomena occur. The first thing many practitioners experience is\nlevitation of the astral body. One has the sensation of floating upward in\nspace, leaving the physical body behind. This is due to the energy of kundaiini\nwhose ascending momentum causes the astral body to disassociate from the\nphysical and move upward. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>HOMOSEXUALS WHO REVEL\nIN ANAL SEX CAN NEVER RISE BEYOND THE MOOLADHARA CHAKRA\u2014 THEY ARE DOOMED \u2013 THEIR SOULS\nCAN GO ONLY TO THE FIRST ASTRAL LAYER, TO BE RE-INDUCTED AS PROBABLY A LEPER OR IMPOTENT MAN IN THE NEXT LIFE&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><b>THE REASON WHY THERE\nARE SO MANY WHITE HOMOSEXUALS ( ANAL SEX PARTY ) IS BECAUSE THEIR ANCESTORS\nWERE CANNIBALS&nbsp;</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This phenomenon is\nlimited to the astral and possibly mental dimensions, and this differs from\nwhat is normally called levitation - the actual displacement of the physical\nbody. Sometimes we see morons trying to physically fly in videos on the\nInternet by flexing their ass muscles -- this is is rock bottom ( or Mooladhara\n) of ignorance and the height of stupidity..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The&nbsp;&nbsp; power&nbsp;&nbsp;\nof&nbsp;&nbsp; the&nbsp;&nbsp; chakras&nbsp;&nbsp;\ndoes&nbsp;&nbsp; not&nbsp;&nbsp; reside&nbsp;&nbsp;\nin&nbsp;&nbsp; the chakras themselves, but\nin sahasrara. The chakras are only transducers . &nbsp;It is only when kundalini reaches ajna chakra\nthat the transcendence begins.&nbsp; All the\npotential lies in sahasrara. The literal meaning of the word sahasrara is 'one\nthousand'. For this reason it is said to be a lotus with one thousand petals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sahasrara is the\nculmination of yoga, the perfect union between shiva and Shakti and the\nunfolding of enlightenment.&nbsp;&nbsp; When this\nunion takes place, the moment of self-realization or samadhi begins. At this\npoint the individual man dies.&nbsp; I don't\nmean that physical death occurs, it is death of the mundane awareness or\nindividual awareness.&nbsp; It is death of the\nexperience of name and form. At this time you don't&nbsp;&nbsp; remember&nbsp;&nbsp;\nthe&nbsp;&nbsp; 'I',&nbsp;&nbsp; the&nbsp;&nbsp;\n'you'&nbsp;&nbsp; or&nbsp;&nbsp; the&nbsp;&nbsp;\n'they'.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The&nbsp;&nbsp; experience,&nbsp;&nbsp;\nthe&nbsp;&nbsp; experienced&nbsp;&nbsp; and&nbsp;&nbsp; the\nexperiencer are one and the same. The seer, seeing and and seen are merged as a\nunified whole. In other words, there is no multiple or dual awareness. There is\nonly single awareness. When Shiva and Shakti unite, nothing remains, there is\nabsolute silence. Shakti does not remain Shakti and Shiva is no more Shiva,\nboth are mingled into one and they can no longer be identified as two different\nforces.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In due course the\nKundalini energy comes down, ideally taking residence in the heart anahata\nchakra,&nbsp; balancing upper and lower\nchakras.&nbsp; You live a normal life,\nassociating with everybody and discharging your worldly obligations like other\npeople do. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now you are in the\nmidst of games of victory and defeat,&nbsp;\nattachments and infatuations,&nbsp; but\nyou just play a game.&nbsp; You know it; you\ndo everything as an actor.&nbsp; You are not\ninvolved in it life and soul .&nbsp; People\nrecognize you as a divine incarnation reality.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Shiva and Shakti\ndescend to the gross level of awareness there is again duality. That is why the\nself-realized man is able to understand pain and all the mundane affairs of\nlife.&nbsp; He understands the whole drama of\nduality, multiplicity and diversity.&nbsp;\nSometimes we ordinary mortals are at a fix to understand how this man\nwith the highest attainment is able to cope with the hopeless dualities of\nlife.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shakti rules the matter\nand Shiva rules the consciousness, and when they descend to the gross plane,\nShakti continues to rule the matter and Shiva, being consciousness, gives an\nunderstanding to the whole world.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are three\nchannels through which the spiritual energies of the kundalini can rise. The\none recommended is the sushumna. The other two are to be avoided.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is very important\nthat you awaken sushumna before attempting to raise the kundalini\u2014by balancing\nthe ida and pingala nadis..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the systematic\nprocess of awakening kundalini,&nbsp; the\nfirst step is to purify and balance ida and pingala nadis and create harmony in\ntheir functioning.&nbsp; Next, all the chakras\nhave to be awakened. Then sushumna nadi is awakened, and when there is a clear\npathway for its ascent, only then kundalini can be awakened. This is the reason\nwhy it must be done under a qualified guru.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the kundalini shakti\nflows outside of the sushumna nadi into and through the ida nadi on the left\nside of the spine, which corresponds to the left sympathetic nerve system, it\nis fragmented into other smaller and more sensitive nerve currents connected to\nthe organs of the physical body. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It produces heat within\nthis formerly cool nadi network. The person becomes overly emotional, feminine\nin nature, talks a lot, often has hurt feelings, cries at the least provocation\nand engages in other emotional behavior patterns that center around the\npersonal I-ness<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the serpent power\nflows up through the pingala nadi and into the sympathetic nerve network on the\nright side of the body, the person becomes overly intellectual, very masculine\nin nature, talks little,&nbsp; has steel\nnerves and patterns centering around the conquest of others through\nintellectual debate.&nbsp; He is prone to long\nsilences, holding in emotions, and to secret patterns of behavior to stimulate\nor satisfy base desires.&nbsp; In other words,\nhe is not open, smiling, friendly, companionable.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In either case, the\nkundalini shakti rising through the ida or pingala can move upward only to the\nmanipura chakra and no farther. This is the impasse.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the Kundalini shakti\nmoves through either of the other of the two wrong channels, it will produce\nacute discomfort, physically, emotionally, intellectually and astrally -- that\nno Western doctor's effort can fathom the cause of , or effect a cure.&nbsp; Western medicine is presently not equipped to\nhandle these problems . The psychological symptoms tend to mimic schizophrenia.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is very likely,\ntherefore, that such individuals may be diagnosed as schizophrenics and be\neither institutionalized for madness or given very drastic and unwarranted\ntreatment.&nbsp; As long as we look at the\nsymptom only and not the cause, which is only expressed in the physical,\nemotional and mental bodies, the treatment will be inadequate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Billions of nervous\nconnections can \u2018burn\u2019 and dissolve, leading to mental illness, symptoms of\nstrokes or multiple sclerosis.&nbsp; Such\naccidents usually are the consequences of a premature Kundalini awakening due\nto modern drugs like LSD, DMT, Ecstasy or others. If the nervous system is not\nready to handle a sudden \u2018power surge\u2019 of cosmic magnitude, the awakening can\nresult in serious damage to the body, especially the brain . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the other hand, when\nKundalini awakens naturally, self-regulating systems within the body\nharmoniously control and limit the amount of electricity released.&nbsp; As a result of this filtering mechanism, the\nnervous system progressively adjusts to the extra power, rather than\nself-destructing.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the Kundalini\nawakens it may stir up a lot of repressed feelings and traumas from the\nunconscious and cause considerable anguish and pain in the individual.&nbsp; Grown ups adults will cry\nuncontrollably.&nbsp; A premature Kundalini\nawakening too may cause psychotic episodes in individuals with severe early\ntraumas. Such traumas are usually associated with serious organic or biological\ndisturbances.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the preparation is\ninsufficient, at various junctures, as it rises, the kundalini shakti, or\nserpent power, attacks the organs in the vicinity of the chakra it is passing\nthrough, biting and poisoning them on the astral level. The poison flows\nthrough all organs, temporary physical, mental and emotional suffering is the\nconsequence . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As it climbs, each one\nof the astral organs is hurt and felt as a physical ailment. This often\nreflects as a symptomatic problem in the kidneys, then stomach problems and\nlater heart problems and thyroid difficulties. At each juncture, the western\ndoctor would be perplexed by the ailment, unable to find a medical cause, then\ndoubly perplexed when that problem disappears suddenly and the next new one\narises.&nbsp; Though treatments and multiple\ntests are more than often given, the source of the problems is usually\nundetected.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Everyone is craving\nkundalini awakening, but few people have the discipline and mental, emotional,\nphysical and nervous preparation required to avoid damage to the brain and\ntissues. If ever you become scared and want to stop the process of kundalini\nawakening, all you have to do is revert to a gross lifestyle.&nbsp; Just revise all your base passions, cunning\ndreams and worldly ambitions .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kundalini can remain\nstuck in one chakra for many years. Sometimes, when kundalini gets blocked in a\nchakra during transit,&nbsp; you begin to\nexhibit some of the siddhis or psychic powers associated with that chakra.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again , never attempt\nto activate or raise Kundalini without a guru.&nbsp;\nAttempting to raise alone could cause permanent mental damage. Kundalini\nis for ADULT energy bodies only - no children are allowed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/02/chakra-vortex-scalar-energy-transciever.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/02/chakra-vortex-scalar-energy-transciever.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Kundalini is\nawakened from its slumber, it hisses like a disturbed serpent and enters the\nhole of Sushumna.&nbsp; The rising Kundalini\nspeeds up the the 6 chakras enroute before it reaches the brain. When it\ntravels from Chakra to Chakra, layer after layer of the mind becomes open and\nthe Yogi acquires various Siddhis (psychic powers).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chakras are centres of\nspiritual energy. They are located in the astral body, but they have\ncorresponding centres in the physical body also. They cannot be the naked eyes.\nOnly a clairvoyant can see with his astral eyes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So each of the\nprincipal chakras can be visualized as a lotus flower with a specific color and\nnumber of petals as follows:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mooladhara - 4 petalled\ndeep red lotus<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swadhisthana&nbsp; - 6 petalled vermilion lotus<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manipura - 10 petalled\nbright yellow lotus<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anahata - 12 petalled\nblue lotus<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vishuddhi - 16 petalled\nviolet lotus<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ajna - 2 petalled\nsilver-grey lotus<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sahasrara - 1000\npetalled multicolored or red lotus<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Music Chakra Sanskrit\nscale<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Do mooladhara Sa<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Re swadhisthana&nbsp; Re<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mi manipura&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; GaFa anahata Ma<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So vishuddhi&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Pa<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">La ajna Dha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ti bindu Ni<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Do sahasrara&nbsp;&nbsp; Sa<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bija mantras for\neach kshetram and chakra are as follows:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">mooladhara lam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">swadhisthana vam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">mianipura ram<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">anahata yam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">vishuddhi ham<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ajna \u043em<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">bindu &nbsp;ALL AH<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In each chakra six\nthings are combined : 1) the chakra color, 2) the petals of the lotus flower,\n3) the yantra or geometrical shape, 4) the bija mantra, 5) the animal symbol,\n6) the higher or divine symbol. Each chakra contains an animal and divine beings.\nThe animals represent your previous evolution and instincts, and the divine\nbeings represent higher consciousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In mooladhara, the\nkarmas of the lower stages of our evolution are manifested in the form of\nanger, greed, jealousy, passion, love, hatred and so on. There we are working\nout that karma, manifesting and expressing it overtly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When kundalini ascends\nfrom mooladhara to swadhisthana, the sadhaka experiences a crucial period in\nwhich all his repressed emotions, especially those of a more primal nature,\nexpress themselves. Passions mount during this period and all kinds of\ninfatuations ensue, making the sadhaka extremely irritable and unstable at\ntimes.&nbsp; He can be seen sitting quietly in\ncontemplation one moment and hurling objects at someone the next.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One day he may sleep\ndeeply for hours together, another day he may get up at one or two in the\nmorning to take bath and meditate.&nbsp; He\nbecomes very passionate, loud and talkative, while at other times he is silent.\nAll&nbsp;&nbsp; the&nbsp;&nbsp; karmas,&nbsp;&nbsp;\nthe&nbsp;&nbsp; past&nbsp;&nbsp; lives,&nbsp;&nbsp;\nthe&nbsp;&nbsp; previous experiences, the\ngreater dimension of the human personality that is unconscious, can be\nsymbolized by swadhisthana chakra.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the level of\nswadhisthana, however, there is no conscious activity or manifestation. This is\nhiranyagarbha, the universal womb, where everything exists in a potential\nstate. All those insignificant and unimpressive karmas, which have been\nregistered automatically in our consciousness, form the total unconscious. In\nkundalini yoga, swadhisthana is often regarded as a hindrance in the sense that\nthese karmas lying embedded in the unconscious do not allow the rising\nkundalini to pass through.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the initial\nawakening, kundalini returns to dormancy time and time again, solely due to the\nkarmic block at swadhisthana.&nbsp; When\nkundalini is residing in swadhisthana chakra, the last vestige of karma is\nbeing thrown out and all the negative samskaras express themselves and are\nexpelled.&nbsp; At this time you may be angry,\nafraid or full of sexual fantasies and passion.&nbsp;\nYou may also experience lethargy, indolence, depression and all kinds of\ntamasic characteristics. The tendency to procrastinate is very strong and you\njust want to sleep and sleep. This&nbsp; stage\nof evolution is known as purgatory.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the liberated energy\n(Kundalini) courses through the system, it actually sweeps away samskaras \u2013\nkarmic traces from the past that are still imprinted in the body and mind \u2013\nlike floodwaters clearing clogged debris from a river bed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When no sexual desires\nof any kind manifest in an aspirant any more, and when there is no more\npersonal attraction, that means kundalini has passed beyond swadhisthana\nchakra.&nbsp; Once you pass swadhisthana you\nwill not have to face any explosive traumas again, but there will be other\ndifficulties further on.&nbsp; Kundalini is\nunlikely to descend again as it is destined to move on whereas from manipura\nonwards higher man predominates.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So mooladhara is the\nseat of kundalini,&nbsp; swadhisthana is the\nabode, and the awakening takes place in manipura.&nbsp; This is because from manipura the awakening\nbecomes ongoing and there is practically no danger of a downfall or devolution\nof consciousness.&nbsp; Up to this point, kundalini\nmay awaken and arise many times, only to recede again, but awakening of\nmanipura is what we call a confirmed awakening. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The force of sadhana\nhas caused a total reorganization of the pranic flow in the body, so that\nmooladhara is transcended and the new base of kundalini is manipura\nchakra.&nbsp; Human evolution takes place through\nseven planes in the same way that kundalini awakens in the seven chakras. When\nthe consciousness evolves to manipura, the sadhaka acquires a spiritual\nperspective. He gets a glimpse of the higher lokas or planes of existence. . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Only when the sadhaka\nreaches manipura is heable to visualize before him the infinite state of\nconsciousness which is no longer gross and empirical.&nbsp; It stretches before him endlessly, full of\nbeauty,&nbsp; truth and auspiciousness. In the\nface of this vision, all his views are completely changed. The personal\nprejudices, complexes&nbsp;&nbsp; and&nbsp;&nbsp; biases&nbsp;&nbsp;\ndrop&nbsp;&nbsp; away&nbsp;&nbsp; as&nbsp;&nbsp;\nthe&nbsp;&nbsp; endless&nbsp;&nbsp; beauty&nbsp;&nbsp;\nand&nbsp;&nbsp; perfection&nbsp;&nbsp; of&nbsp;&nbsp;\nthe&nbsp;&nbsp; higher worlds dawn within\nthe consciousness.whatever he thinks and does will be influenced by this higher\nvision. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is why the psychic\npowers that come to the sadhaka after having awakened and established the\nkundalini in manipura are really benevolent and compassionate, where as those\nwhich manifest in mooladhara and swadhisthana are still tinged by the dark aspect\nof the lower mind.&nbsp; Therefore, manipura\nliterally means \"city of jewels\". <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The powers gained\nthrough the awakening of manipura chakra are the ability to create and destroy,\nself-defence,&nbsp; the acquisition of hidden\ntreasures, no fear of fire, knowledge of one's own body, freedom from disease\nand the ability of sending the energy to sahasrara. The lower chakras belong to\nthe empirical world of body, mind and senses. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People who accept their\nfate as inevitable have not yet transcended rnooladhara and swadhisthana\nchakras. Manipura is still considered earthly, although it lies at the boundary\nbetween mortal and immortal planes. Those who actively shape their own destiny\nthrough strength of will channelled in a positive direction, which leads to\nrealization and achievement, are in the realm of manipura.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word anahata\nactually means 'unstruck or unbeaten'.&nbsp;\nAnahata chakra is situated in the spinal column on the inner wall,\ndirectly behind the center of the chest.&nbsp;\nThis chakra is a very delicate center, for it is directly connected with\nthat part of the brain which is responsible for all the creative sciences and\nfine arts such as painting, dance, music, poetry, etc.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is said that he who\nmeditates on the heart lotus is foremost among yogis and adored by women. He is\npreeminently wise and full of noble deeds.&nbsp;\nHis senses are completely under control and his mind can be engrossed in\nintense concentration.&nbsp; His speech is\ninspired and he has the ability to enter another's body at will. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is at anahata chakra\nis where the thoughts and desires of the individual are materialized and\nfulfilled.&nbsp; There are basically two ways\nof thinking -dependently or independently.&nbsp;\nUp to manipura chakra the first approach holds true, but once the shakti\npierces anahata, the second approach takes precedence. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Anahata chakra is almost completely beyond\nthese empirical dimensions.&nbsp; Here, one\nrealizes that fate is of course real, but still one can go totally beyond its\ndictates. It is like throwing&nbsp;&nbsp;\nsomething&nbsp;&nbsp; into&nbsp;&nbsp; the &nbsp;&nbsp;sky.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nIf&nbsp;&nbsp; you&nbsp;&nbsp; are&nbsp;&nbsp;\nable&nbsp;&nbsp; to&nbsp;&nbsp; hurl&nbsp;&nbsp;\nthat&nbsp;&nbsp; object&nbsp;&nbsp; right&nbsp;&nbsp;\nout&nbsp;&nbsp; of&nbsp;&nbsp; the gravitational field, then it will no\nlonger be pulled down by the earth's magnetic forces. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just as a rocket is\nlaunched at tremendous speed in order to go beyond the gravitational pull of\nthe earth, ( AIYYYOOO &nbsp;AKKAL KA DUSHMA\nTALKED ABOUT ESCAPE VELOCITY\u2014THE KALLAN PEEKS INTO MY BLOGS ) so the\nconsciousness is accelerated in anahata to the speed of free will in order to\ntranscend the pull of latent samskaras. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is only when you\nreach anahata chakra that you become a yogi.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Up until then, whether\nyou are in mooladhara, swadhisthana or manipura, you are a yoga\npractitioner.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In anahata you become a\nyogi because you are completely established in yogic consciousness and you\ndepend solely upon the power of your own consciousness rather than on anything\nthat is external or concerning faith..&nbsp;\nIf the consciousness awakens in anahata, but you do not know the powers\nof your mind, or you possess negative, pessimistic attitudes, dark approaches to\nlife, apprehensions, fears and many other negative mental tendencies, then you\nwill immediately fall prey to them. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If this happens, you\nrisk the possibility of falling back from anahata.&nbsp; And if you fall from anahata, there is hardly\nany chance of making a second start. To avoid a downfall at this point, it is\nnecessary to always remain as alert as the antelope, which is sensitive to each\nand every sound. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Anahata chakra\nawakens refined emotion in the brain and its awakening is characterized by a\nfeeling of universal, unlimited love for all beings.&nbsp; Just&nbsp;&nbsp;\nas&nbsp;&nbsp; the&nbsp;&nbsp; sun&nbsp;&nbsp;\nremoves&nbsp;&nbsp; darkness,&nbsp;&nbsp; love&nbsp;&nbsp;\nremoves ego. These two can never coexist. When kundalini is established\nin anahata there is absolute devotion and even a confirmed atheist will change.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anahata is the seat of\nhuman love and the seat of divine love. One obtains complete emotional\nbalanceand the ability to communicate externally as well as internally. Voices\nor sounds coming from other realms may be heard, and buzzing or humming sounds\nand the music of a flute may be experienced. The sadhaka may become an insired\npoet, artist or singer.&nbsp; He may manifest\nclairvoyant /clairaudient or psychokinetic ability.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A person who is in\nanahata is generally very sensitive to the feelings of others and his sense of\ntouch is strongly developed.&nbsp; He also has\nthe ability to heal others, either by touch or by generating his own spiritual\nenergy to other people in order to effect curative changes. Many people who\nperform miraculous healings do so through the agency of anahata chakra.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vishuddhi chakra is\nknown as the 'purification center'. The Sanskrit word shuddhi means (to\npurify), and in this chakra the purifying and harmonizing of all opposites\ntakes place. Vishuddhi allows us to differentiate between realization coming\ninto our consciousness from the higher levels of knowledge, and the mere\nbabblings of our unconscious mind and wishful thinking. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vishuddhi chakra is in\nthe cervical plexus directly behind the throat pit.&nbsp; Its kshetramis in the front of the neck, at\nthe throat pit or thyroid gland.&nbsp; The as\na purple lotus of sixteen petals. These sixteen petals correspond to the number\nof nadis associated with this center.&nbsp; It\nis represented by the element of ether or akasha. This ethereal region is the\ngateway to liberation for one whose senses are pure and controlled . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When vishuddhi is\nawakened , amrit, the divine fluid is retained and utilized, becoming the\nnectar of immortality. The secret of youth and regeneration of the body lies in\nthe awakening of vishuddhi chakra. . The thought waves of others are also\nexperienced elsewhere in the body, in other centers such as manipura, but the\nactual reception center of thought waves and transmissions is vishuddhi.&nbsp; From vishuddhi they are relayed to the centers\nin the brain associated with the other chakras and in this way they enter into\nthe individual awareness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The seat of bindu is at\nthe top back of the head, exactly at the spot where the Hindu brahmins leave a\ntuft of hair growing. Although this custom is still being followed today, its\noriginal purpose has been completely forgotten. In Sanskrit that tuft of hair\nis called shikha, which means 'the flame of fire'.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The pineal gland has\nverified that it is the anatomical and functional concomitant of ajna chakra.\nWhen the energy rises to the fourth centre, the heart or Anahata, spiritual\nawakening takes place. At this stage the heart is flowering with love, and man\nhas a spiritual vision of the divine light. His mind then no longer runs after\nworldly pleasures. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the fifth and\nsixth chakra (throat and eyebrow) are awakened man becomes free of ignorance\nand all information is available to him through his intuition. Finally, when\nthe energy reaches the crown chakra on the top of the head, man experiences\nSamadhi.&nbsp; Samadhi is a state where\nconsciousness experiences itself and its oneness with God.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Shiva and Shakti\nunite in sahasrara, one experiences samadhi, illumination occurs in the brain\nand the silent areas begin to function . Shiva and Shakti remain merged\ntogether for some time, and during this period there is a total loss of\nconsciousness pertaining to each other.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At that time a bindu\nevolves. Bindu means a point, a drop, and that bindu is the substratum of the\nwhole cosmos.&nbsp; Within that bindu is the\nseat of human intelligence and the seat of the total creation. Then the bindu\nsplits into two , Shiva and Shakti manifest again in duality. When ascension\ntook place it was only the ascent of Shakti, but now, when descension takes\nplace, Shiva and Shakti both descend to the gross plane and there is again\nknowledge of duality. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the descent of\nkundalini occurs to anahata chakra , it means the lower mental plane of the\nhuman being is no longer influenced by the ordinary mind, the supermind takes\nover instead. This higher form of consciousness rules the body, mind and senses\nand directs your life, thoughts and emotions. Kundalini is&nbsp; henceforth the ruler of your life. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By Khechari mudra you\nput pressure on the soft palate in the middle indentation located on the roof\nof the mouth with the tip of your tongue. In the course of time the tongue gets\nelongated and can be inserted into the nasal orifice. Then certain glands which\nare connected with the cranial passage and bindu visarga are stimulated, and as\na result, amrit or nectar begins to flow. When amrit is released you experience\na special type of'high' or intoxication. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Amrit relieves all\nhunger and thirst in very advanced practitioner. At the higher level,&nbsp; bindu is a point. At the lower level, it is\ndrop of liquid, which drips from the male and female orgasm.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tantra, yogis do NOT\nejaculate. They learn to stop it.&nbsp; He\ndoes asanas like vajroli mudra ,&nbsp; moola\nbandha and uddiyana bandha to help him master the control of orgasmic ejaculation.\nThe woman strengthens her sphincter , vaginal and uterine muscles, and hence\nshe is in charge and man is just her medium. There is no bouncing, if you know\nwhat I mean.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I have to be careful\nhere as girls as small as 9 years read my posts. . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the man loses his\nbindu, it means that the woman has failed to carry out her functions properly.\nIn tantra it is said that Shiva is incapable without Shakti.&nbsp; Shakti is the high priestess. The Hindu path\nof dakshina marga must be followed for many years before the path of vama marga\ncan be entered. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The rishis say that the\nsame energy which flows through passion, when channelized, manifests as\ndevotion. Channelize this same energy again and it manifests as spiritual\nexperience. That is why spiritual aspirants love God in various manifestations.\n. Some picture him as a father, a mother, a child, a friend, husband or lover.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Practicing the Khechari\nMudra also stimulates the release of \u201cfeel good\u201d neurotransmitters such as\ndopamine. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With the release of\ncalming and soothing hormones, a Khechari Mudra practitioner also experiences a\nprofound state of calmness and well-being.&nbsp;\nFirst of all it stills your mind and you are in the moment. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Additionally, applying\npressure to the points on the roof of the mouth helps to balance out the\nenergetic pathways throughout the body. In this way, incorporating a regular\npractice of the Khechari Mudra into your Yoga practice will help to revitalize\nyour entire being as the nectar of the gods is released and flows from the\nbindu located at the Third Eye Chakra throughout your whole body. Practicing\nthe Khechari Mudra has the power to awaken the divine Kundalini .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In&nbsp; hatha yoga there is a practice where&nbsp; the root or frenulum of the under surface of\nthe tongue is gradually cut and the tongue is slowly elongated and inserted\ninto the nasopharynx. It blocks off the passage as a cork seals a bottle. The\nwhole practice is perfected over a two year period. By this practice the drops\nfrom bindu fall to vishuddhi and subsequently permeate the whole bodily system.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These drops of nectar\nmaintain the nutrition and vitality of the bodily tissues while simultaneously\narresting the metabolic processes of the body. When the metabolism of the cells\nand tissues of the body is suspended in this way, oxygen is no longer required\nand cellular wastes are not produced. Therefore, the person who hibernates can\nlive without breathing for quite an extended period of time.
