list-style: none; padding: 0px; word-wrap: break-word;\">\nHomosexuality-not a crime in any Smriti. Everyone has male &amp; female elements. According to their dominance,tendencies show up &amp; may change.</div>\n<div class=\"Tweet-metadata dateline\" style=\"color: #697882; font-size: 14px; margin-top: 3.2px;\">\n<a class=\"u-linkBlend u-url customisable-highlight long-permalink\" data-datetime=\"2013-12-11T16:44:16+0000\" data-scribe=\"element:full_timestamp\" href=\"https://twitter.com/SriSri/status/410812289499942912\" style=\"background-color: transparent; font-weight: inherit; outline: 0px; text-decoration: inherit;\">10:14 PM - Dec 11, 2013</a></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But when it is placed on the true Guru, it opens the\npathway for eternal welfare<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blind faith is not\nallowed in Sanatana Dharma. Before placing it on any Guru, we must use our\nintellect to confirm that the Guru has realized the Absolute Truth, and he is\nteaching it in accordance with the eternal Vedic scriptures. Once this is\nconfirmed, then we should strive to deepen our faith in such a Guru, and\nsurrender to God under his guidance. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All the BHAKTI MOVEMENT\nHEROES are FAKE and backdated creations of Jew Rothschild\u2014the most notorious\nbeing the DASA characters .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha means\nunwavering faith.&nbsp; Rituals of worship\nwithout SHRADDHA are lifeless and the effort done in that direction also goes\nwaste. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is SHRADDHA that\ntransforms lifeless stones into living symbols of Divinity capable of showing\nsupernatural powers <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Shraddha varya smriti\nsamadhi praj\u00f3apurvakam itare\u00ccam.-(YogaDarshan-1/20)</span></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Strength, memory and\nSamadhi may be achieved (by even ordinary people) with the aid of <span style=\"background-color: white;\">SHRADDHA</span> and\nwisdom.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The faith of a\nvoiceless newborn remains only on his mother. When this mother becomes old and\nhelpless, her faith remains in her child she had once fed with breast milk <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is faith that\ncreates the bonds of love among the members of family and inspires them to cooperate\nand sacrifice their interests for others. The lack of&nbsp; SHRADDHA alone is responsible for the\ndisintegration of families.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">WHEN THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA , THERE WERE ONLY 4 MUTTS HEADED BY KERALA NAMBOODIRIS ---FROM 2000 BC&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">IN 1947 WHEN THE WHITE INVADER LEFT INDIA, WE HAD MORE THAN A THOUSAND FAKE MUTTS&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">THE 4 ORIGINAL MUTTS HAD CRYPTO JEW PONTIFFS WITH PALE EYES.</span></b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">THESE FAKE MUTTS REMOVED SHRADDHA AND INSERTED BHAKTI&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">IF YOU GO TO AGAMA TEMPLES YOU CAN SEE MEANINGLESS AND ENDLESS RITUALS&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Not everyone has the\nintellect to comprehend the deep imports of the profound dialogue between\nKrishna and Arjun. Here,&nbsp; Krishna\nreassures that if such people merely hear with SHRADDHA , they will also\nbenefit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>A story about a\ndisciple of Adi Shankaracharya, called Sananda, illustrates this point. He was\nilliterate and could not comprehend his Guru\u2019s teaching as the other disciples\ncould. But when Shankaracharya delivered the discourse, he would listen with\nrapt attention and great SHRADDHA . One day, he was washing his Guru\u2019s clothes\non the other side of the river. It became time for the class, and the other\ndisciples requested, \u201cGuruji, please begin the class.\u201d Shankaracharya replied,\n\u201cLet us wait; Sananda is not here.\u201d \u201cBut Guruji, he cannot understand anything,\u201d\nthe disciples urged. \u201cThat is true; still, he listens with great SHRADDHA and\nso I do not wish to disappoint him,\u201d said Shankaracharya.</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AT SCHOOL I HAVE HEARD\nTHE TERM&nbsp; \u201d LISTEN WITH SHRADDHA \u201c&nbsp; &nbsp;HUNDREDS OF TIMES\u2014&nbsp; SHRADDHICHU KELKU ( IN\nMALAYALAM )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shree Krishna assures\nArjun that even those who merely hear the sacred dialogue with great SHRADDHA\nwill gradually become purified.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why do souls who have\nachieved perfection in spiritual practices not know God in truth? This is\nbecause without SHRADDHA , or loving devotion to the Lord, it is not possible\nto know or perceive him.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Spiritual aspirants who\npractice karm, jnana, ha\u1e6dha yog, etc. without including SHRADDHA alongside\ncannot know God. In the Bhagavad Gita, Shree Krishna reiterates this fact many\ntimes.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus, those spiritual\naspirants who do not include SHRADDHA in their sadhana remain restricted to\ntheoretical knowledge of God. They do not get experiential knowledge of the\nAbsolute Truth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The shastras are\ndesigned to ensure the peace and prosperity of the world and the spiritual\nperfection of mankind..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is not blind\nfaith.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;It is based on accurate reasoning, evidence\nand experience.&nbsp;&nbsp; Then only it can be\nlasting faith.&nbsp;&nbsp; Then only it can be\nperfect, unshakeable faith. No spiritual progress is possible without\nshraddha.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From shraddha comes\nnistha or one-pointed devotion and from nistha comes self-realization.&nbsp; Ancient maharishis&nbsp; talked about the quality of \u201cshraddha\u201d which\nis a positive energy that comes from within.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha is a Sanskrit\nMalayalam&nbsp; word -- an unshakable\nconviction in our journey. Shraddha should not be translated as a \u201csimple\u201d\nfaith / trust, --&nbsp; it also conveys mental\nand intellectual firmness <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SINGING BHAJANS LIKE\nASSHOLES ( BHAKTI MOVEMENT OF JEW ROTHSCHILD ) BEATING DHOLAKS&nbsp; AND SHAKING ASS , HAS NEVER BEEN PART OF\nHINDUISM.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BHAJANS IN VERNACULAR\nARE NOT MANTRAS IN SANSKRIT</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE MAGIC OF VEDIC\nSHRUTI IS IN THE SOUND IT GENERATES\u2014NOT THE MEANING OF THE WORDS. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE\nWORDS JUST AROUSE A SENSE OF GRATITUDE WHICH GENERATES SCALAR WAVES IN THE DNA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We build our \u201cshraddha\u201d\nby pushing through fear and trusting implicitly in our inner voice and\nconscience .&nbsp; Shraddha&nbsp; is the divine medicine.&nbsp; This blogsite is creating a silent world\nrevolution by awakening the inner voice <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the opening verses\nof the 17th chapter OF Bhagwad Gita , Krishna says that SHRADDHA results from\nour most steadfast convictions.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When our mind is pure,\nhe says, we find faith in benevolence, having little attachment to what we\nourselves can gain.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At such times, faith\nleads us to value yoga as a means for curtailing sorrow and suffering, and for\ndirecting our mind toward transcendental truths.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SHRADDHA sustains us\nlike a loving mother. We are calmed by its presence.&nbsp; We rest and grow in it. It nurtures us. To\nillustrate this, SHRADDHA ( faith/ trust ) is frequently personified in India\nas a feminine image\u2014a loving and protective force that nurtures us like a\nmother or a goddess.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjali\u2019s concept of\nSHRADDHA, is not a religious commitment but a deeply personal expression of\ninner harmony.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Trust in the words of\nthe teacher and Vedanta is SHRADDHA. Yoga offers assurance of renewed health,\nrestored self-confidence, or of a spiritual reality beckoning from within.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Out\nof these or similar certitudes, threads are woven together, gradually forming a\nfabric of SHRADDHAthat is distinctively yours.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ayurveda used organic\nfood as preventive medicine \u2013with&nbsp;\nSHRADDHA. A promise is held out .&nbsp;&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blind devotion and\nbelief takes a back seat in Sanatana Dharma</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SHRADDHA is the soul's\nbelief in the Divine's existence, wisdom, power, love and grace.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bhagavad Gita\nconfirms this idea of SHRADDHA \u2014and adds to it. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Krishna says that SHRADDHA\n&nbsp;results from our most steadfast\nconvictions. When our mind is pure, he says, we find faith in benevolence,\nhaving little attachment to what we ourselves can gain. At such times, faith\nleads us to value yoga as a means for curtailing sorrow and suffering, and for\ndirecting our mind toward transcendental truths. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The way each of us\nlives out our lives reflects the nature of our faith. Yoga itself is an act of\nfaith arising from the heart, and by having faith in the fundamental aims of\nyoga, \u201ca faithful person obtains knowledge.\u201d (BG 4.39)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But a person whose\nfaith is based only on mundane truths ( LIKE I AM SURE TO WIN THE JACKPOT ) ,\nor who is without faith and overwhelmed by doubt, \u201ccomes to nothing.\u201d (BG 4.40)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Faith sustains us like\na loving mother. We are calmed by its presence. We rest and grow in it. It\nnurtures us. To illustrate this, faith is frequently personified in India as a\nfeminine image\u2014a loving and protective force that nurtures us like a mother or\na goddess.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\">The Bhagavad Gita says\nthat a person is what their SHRADDHA is \u2013that says it all.</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha is not as much\na spiritual-based faith as a faith in oneself and YOUR INNER VOICE your\nshraddha is reflected through your virtues and values, it is what defines your\nsense of Self, your character.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your character, or your nature, determines your\ndestiny. It shapes how you perceive, live in, and are motivated in the world.\nCultivating the wisdom to trust in your nature is developed through living in\nalignment with your truth. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Family and\ncommunity gatherings offer a special opportunity to practice this authentic\nalignment, especially when the conversation turns to a \u201ctouchy\u201d subject like\npolitics, religion, or spirituality. The more emotionally invested you are in\nsomething the more passionate. The more confident, established, and realized\nyou are in your SHRADDHA &nbsp;the less\naffected you are by conflicting opinions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Living in alignment with your\nshraddha and dharma requires you to take action and possibly change in ways\nthat are challenging. Once you feel the joy that follows honoring your shraddha\nand dharma, though, you will want to experience it again and again. SHRADDHA is\nthe strongest and highest power in moulding one\u2019s life in a specific direction.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The essence of SHRADDHA \u2013 unshakable belief in noble ideals. When this belief\nin high principles goes up to the level of making it a practice, a part of\nlife, it is called devotion; and when this matured belief enters the field of\nrealization of Self and that of God, it is called Siddhi.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the field of\nspirituality, the power of SHRADDHA &nbsp;is\nsupreme.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">SPRIRITUALITY IS\nIMPOSSIBLE WITHOUT SHRADDHA</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IT TAKES A CAPT AJIT\nVADAKAYIL TO SAY THIS 4000 YEARS AFTER ADI SHANKARACHARYA <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SANATANA DHARMA IS\nADVANCES QUANTUM PHYSICS.&nbsp; THE LAWS OF\nKARMA ARE ROOTED IN QUANTUM PHYSICS/<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/01/advaita-vedanta-philosophy-adi.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/01/advaita-vedanta-philosophy-adi.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The more you know, the\nmore will be the feeling that you don\u2019t know.&nbsp;\nRecognition of the unknown is Shraddha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjali\u2019s concept of SHRADDHA,\nis not a religious commitment but a deeply personal expression of inner\nharmony.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Experience can never\nremove ignorance, as experience does not negate ignorance.&nbsp; Neither action nor experience can remove\nignorance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The scriptures give a\ntechnical definition to pramana<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are five\nconditions for a thing to be a pramana;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1)&nbsp; It has to produce knowledge. 2) It has to\nproduce a new knowledge. 3) It has to produce uncontradicted knowledge. 4) It\nhas to produce a doubtless knowledge. 5) It has to produce a useful knowledge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">anadhigata, abAdhita\nasandigdha phalavat jn~Ana janakam pramANam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--.&nbsp; The pramANa should produce knowledge (jn~Ana\njanakatvam). Mystic experiences or actions cannot produce knowledge, hence they\nare not pramANas. Upanishadik statements do reveal the self and hence produce\nknowledge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">---. What a pramANa\ntalks about should not be talked about by any other pramANa. (anadhigatatvam).\nIt should be a new knowledge not gained in any other way.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">---. What a pramana\nreveals should not be contradicted by any other pramana (abadhitatvam); for\ne.g., the eye gives form knowledge, so it is giving us a knowledge which is\nnew.&nbsp;&nbsp; Also, the form knowledge given by\nthe eye can never be negated by the ear. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ear can never come\nup with a knowledge that says, the form reported by the eye is wrong.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pram\u0101\u1e47a forms one part\nof a tripu\u0163i (trio) of concepts, which describe the ancient Indian view on how\nknowledge is gained. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The other two concepts\nare knower and knowable, each discussed in how they influence the knowledge, by\ntheir own characteristic and the process of knowing. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The two are called\nPramat\u0157 ( the subject, the knower) and Prameya ( the object, the knowable).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pramana, a valid means\nof knowledge for revealing the corresponding objects.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We should have a\nsimilar trust in Vedanta because Vedanta is a Pramana for the truth about the\nSelf.&nbsp;&nbsp; The Self is not available for\nperception.&nbsp;&nbsp; It cannot be grasped by the\norgans of perception, the mind, or words.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Self cannot be\ncomprehended by any means of knowledge other than Vedanta.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha, is surrender\nto the Pramana so that the Pramana can operate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pramana&nbsp; literally means \"proof\" and\n\"means of knowledge\". It refers to epistemology in Indian\nphilosophies, and is one of the key, much debated fields of study in Hinduism<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a theory of\nknowledge, and encompasses one or more reliable and valid means by which human\nbeings gain accurate, true knowledge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The focus of Pramana is\nhow correct knowledge can be acquired, how one knows, how one doesn't, and to\nwhat extent knowledge pertinent about someone or something can be acquired.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ancient and medieval\nIndian texts identify six pramanas as correct means of accurate knowledge and\nto truths: perception (Sanskrit pratyak\u1e63a), inference (anumana), comparison and\nanalogy(upamana), postulation, derivation from circumstances (arthapatti), non-perception,\nnegative/cognitive proof (anupalabdhi) and word, testimony of past or present\nreliable experts (\u015aabda).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each of these are\nfurther categorized in terms of conditionality, completeness, confidence and\npossibility of error, Prama\u1e47a literally means \"proof\". The word also\nrefers to a concept and field of Indian philosophy. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The concept is derived\nfrom the Sanskrit root, prama which means \"correct notion, true knowledge,\nbasis, foundation, accurate notion\".&nbsp;\nThe concept Pramana implies that which is a \"means of acquiring\nprama or certain, correct, true knowledge\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Accepting Veda (sruti\n)&nbsp; as a pramana is first step of vedantik\nenquiry.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedanta being a\npramana, no experience can ever contradict it; since the definition says that a\npramANa can never be contradicted.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is absurd to call\nvedanta&nbsp; (sruti ) a non pramana. It would\nbe equally absurd to call SHRADDHA in veda as \u2018rigid belief\u2019.&nbsp; Shraddha cannot be translated into belief at\nall.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Shraddhat we have\nin Vedanta enables us to maintain a certain frame of mind wherein we don\u2019t\nquestion what Vedanta says, but try to understand what it says.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha or trust does\nnot mean that we have to blindly accept whatever the teacher tells us. It only\nmeans that we give it the benefit of the doubt and look upon it with a certain\nreverence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha, trust /\nfaith,&nbsp; must arise in its own way.&nbsp; It must be discovered. It cannot be\ncommanded. This reverence for scripture cannot be thrust upon anybody.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We discover it as we\nget exposed to Vedanta, appreciate its profundity and clarity, and see how it\nreleases us from different notions and complexes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just as we cannot make\nourselves love someone, we cannot make ourselves have Shraddha.&nbsp;&nbsp; Love has to manifest itself.&nbsp; Similarly, Shraddha is not something that we\ncan command; it has to happen.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha, trust and\nreverence, is essential to learn and enjoy an open mind.&nbsp; An open mind is willing to shed its\nconclusions and prejudices and is ready to learn and change<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In having Shraddha,\nthere is trust, faith, reverence, devotion, openness, and freedom. In fact,\nthis is the trust where there is freedom.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word FAITH scares a\nHindu.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A&nbsp; Hindu free of dogma ( like in other single\nholy book religions ) is skeptical when this question of trust / faith arises\nbecause faith is always understood to be blind faith.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But here we are talking\nnot about blind faith, but ENLIGHTENED FAITH ( SHRADDHA )faith, a faith that we\ndiscover as a result of self verification.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As we listen and\nunderstand Vedanta and try to assimilate and implement it in our lives, we\ndiscover its validity and take the next step.&nbsp;\nWe do not simply believe it, but proceed as we discover the validity of\nthe truth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedanta says that\nhappiness is not to be found outside, but is to be discovered within ourselves\nas it is our own nature.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me stop the\nexternal pursuit of happiness and focus my attention on myself and see whether\nI am able to discover inner peace or not.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha or reverential\nfaith enables that learning frame of mind and, therefore, is freedom.&nbsp;&nbsp; Such a mind remains free from doubts and\nquestions and open to the teacher and the teaching.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha is defined as\ntrust or faith in the words of Vedanta pending verification.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha is faith in\nVedanta as a Pramana, a means of knowledge for knowing the Self, just as eyes\nare a means of knowledge with respect to colour and form. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedanta is not to be\nlooked upon as speculation or philosophy.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha is trust in\nthe Guru too.&nbsp; Trust in the Guru&nbsp; is required because the key to Vedanta is the\nteaching tradition.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We have too many\nhomosexuals claiming to be brahmacharis \u2013 they are sponsored by Benami media\u2014we\nknow who they are.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again , shraddha is not\nblind faith, but enlightened faith based on verification.&nbsp; We discover faith when we implement Vedanta\nin our lives and verify whether what the teachings say is true.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Faith is the ability to\nbelieve what we do not see. The reward of faith is to see what we did not\nbelieve.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha is more than\nmere faith.&nbsp;&nbsp; It also implies\nself\u2013reliance, an independent sense of right and wrong,&nbsp; reliance on conscience and the courage of\none\u2019s own conviction&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Faith in Sanatana\nDharma begins as an experiment and ends as an experience.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SHRADDHA expressed in\naction is a sure means of realization. &nbsp;SHRADDHA is not blind.&nbsp; It is the willingness to try free of threats\nof dogma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Faith is the belief in\nthe unknown.&nbsp; Faith heals, faith creates,\nfaith works wonders, faith moves mountains. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SHRADDHA ( not bhakti )\n&nbsp;is the searchlight for finding brahman.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He who has no faith in\nhimself can never have faith in God.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the context of\nVedanta it is the trust that one has in Veda ( sruti ) , where the Veda is\ntaken to be a valid means of knowledge(pramana).&nbsp;&nbsp; It is the deep trust that the Veda is a\nmeans to knowledge, hence a means for liberation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedas are timeless and\napaurusheya (not a fabrication of human mind).&nbsp;&nbsp;\nThey are eternal and are revealed to mankind by seers (\nmaharishis).&nbsp;&nbsp; This vedic wisdom has\nprovided many with knowledge. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The spiritual stalwarts\nare living examples for us as a proof for the validity of the vedas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Single messiah , single\nholy book religions cry \u201cGod is there to save you\u201d, \u201cYou have sinned and need a\nsaviour\u201d etc; under such contexts a blind faith props up.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You believe in the\nsaviour thinking that you have sinned.&nbsp;\nYou are doomed if you do not believe the saviour.&nbsp;&nbsp; That will be YET YENOTHER&nbsp; sin !</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedanta says you need\nnot be saved at all. You alone are the truth, the non dual truth. There is no\nrescue work needed!&nbsp; Where is the\nquestion of blind faith, when all that is needed is SHRADDHA and knowledge. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Liberation for us is\nthrough knowledge, and here, there is no role for blind faith to play.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Hindu is allowed to\nquestion and discuss; but the attitude matters.&nbsp;&nbsp; If one questions with the idea of throwing\nshit on Veda, then it is lack of shraddha (ashraddha).&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Instead if one says,\nveda cannot be wrong, but there is some confusion in my understanding and the\nconcept of me being the whole, the truth, is not sinking; then it is\nshraddha.&nbsp; The person has doubts,\nconviction is not there, but he has trust in the veda as being a valid means of\nknowledge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many of our Upanishads\nare in the form of dialogue between guru and disciple.&nbsp; The student asks questions till he gains\nconviction.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Neither the guru nor\nthe upanishad expects you to listen once, blindly accept and pack up.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a gradual\nunfolding of Vedanta by an adept guru. The whole learning environment is open,\ngraceful,&nbsp; friendly, encouraging, logical\nand of course filled with shraddha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Faith is what you\nbelieve in with conviction. Trust, confidence, belief, assumptions,\nexpectations and inferences are aspects of faith<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since God is invisible\nand unknowable to the senses, and since he cannot be verified by rational\nmeans, tradition suggests that the Vedas should be used to sustain faith,\nholding them as the reliable sources of verbal testimony to establish\nmetaphysical truths about him and his eternal laws.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since they cannot\nrationally or empirically be established we have to rely upon faith and the\nknowledge of the scriptures to practice dharma and strive for liberation.&nbsp; While reason belongs to the mind, faith\nbelongs to the heart.&nbsp; Hence, intuition\nis regarded as a corollary of faith. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Brihadaranyaka\nUpanishad (3.29.1) declares that the resting ground of SHRADDHA &nbsp;is the heart.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In&nbsp; Sanatana Dharma shraddha is used in a very\nbroad sense. It not only means faith/ trust/ belief but also interest,\ndedication and application.&nbsp; They are\ninterrelated.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, you cannot\nbe interested in any goal unless you believe in its possibility.&nbsp; You cannot dedicate yourself to a cause or to\na path, unless you know in your heart, or believe, that it is good for you or\nlead you in the right direction.&nbsp; None of\nit would be possible, unless you have faith in yourself.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SHRADDA WAS REPLACED BY\nBHAKTI&nbsp; (BLIND DEVOTION ) AND SANATANA\nDHARMA WAS HIJACKED BY JEW ROTHSCHILD ..&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AT EVERY DESH DROHI\nLITERARY FEST,&nbsp;&nbsp; A HUGE CHUNK OF TIME IS\nLEFT ASIDE FOR THE FAKE AND BACKDATED CREATIONS OF ROTHSCHILDs BHAKTI MOVEMENT <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FROM NOW ON I ASK MY\nREADERS TO WATCH THESE FOREIGN FUNDED DROHIS <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE ASK MODI TO FIT\nHIDDEN CAMS .. WE KNOW WHO THE TRAITORS ARE .. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AGAMA OF THE FAKE TAMIL\nMUTTS INTRODUCED LENGTHY, PONDEROUS , MEANINGLESS RITUALS , GIVING MONOPOLY TO\nSTOOGE BRAHMINS \u2013 NONE OF WHICH BELONG TO SANATANA DHARMA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You should have SHRADDHA\nnot only to practice your religion or achieve liberation but also to gain\nmastery in any endeavor.&nbsp; &nbsp;SHRADDHA is propelled by both conviction and\ndedication.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Faith according to\nHinduism is the sum of your worldview, your values and convictions.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It encompasses the\nwhole spectrum of your thought since much of what you know is what you believe\nto be worth remembering and paying attention to.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From faith arises\ntrust, devotion, loyalty, commitment, dedication and assurance.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Faith may arise from\nsimple observation, facts, inference, intuition, assurance, experience,\ncommonsense or a simple belief.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Faith is difficult to\nsustain because the world is an appearance, and we are subject to delusion and\nignorance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hindu tradition never\ndemanded that their students should blindly believe or \"swallow\"\nanything&nbsp; -- <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201c IF YOU DON\u2019T LIKE IT\n, LUMP IT \u201c&nbsp;&nbsp; TYPE DOGMA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HINDUS ARE ASKED TO\nAPPLY THEIR CONSCIENCE .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MY BLOGPOSTS DON\u2019T ASK\nYOUR TO LUMP ANYTHING..&nbsp; YOU HAVE TO\nAPPLY YOUR CONCIENCE.. I JUST AWAKEN YOUR INNER VOICE AND SHRADDHA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No guru wants his\nstudents to believe; he wanted his students to understand and agree . A teacher\nwants students to understand, to know, unlike a SINGLE HOLY BOOK DOGMA preacher\nwho wants listeners to believe.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The goal, as understood\nby the ancient rishis, is not to merely believe in God, but to know God\ndirectly.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">EVEN ADI SHANKARACHARYA\nWAS CONVERTED TO A BHAKTI CHARACTER<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THIS FOUL AND CUNNING\nSUBSTITUTION OF SHRADDHA WITH BHAKTI, IN THE WARP AND WEFT OF HINDUISM BY JEW\nROTHSCHILD REDUCED&nbsp; THE GREAT\nSPIRITUALITY OF SANATANA DHARMA TO THE ABSURD LEVEL OF SINGLE HOLY BOOK/ SINGLE\nMESSIAH RELIGIONS .. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GURU NANAK WAS MADE\nPART OF THE BHAKTI MOVEMENT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SIKHISM WAS WEDGED\nAPART FROM SANATANA DHARMA, WITH A SINGLE HOLY BOOK&nbsp; .. BY A EVIL GERMAN JEW&nbsp; .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TODAY SIKHS IN UK AND\nCANADA SAY\u2014WE DON\u2019T BELONG TO INDIA\u2014WE HAVE NOTHINGTO DO WITH HINDUISM<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VERY SOON YOU WILL SEE\nA \u201cSIKH BRIGAGE \u201c IN BRITAIN AND CANADA \u2013&nbsp;\nJUST LIKE THE GORKHA BRIGADE \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE FINAL SIKH HOLY\nBOOK GURU GRANTH SABIB ( WHAT YOU SEE TODAY ) WAS WRITTEN BY A JEW ROTHSCHILDs\nAGENT \u2013 A WHITE SKINNED JEW MAX ARTHUR MACAULIFFE WEARING TURBAN AND 5 K.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most of the initial\nSikh Indian leaders ( including Khalistanis ) were CRYPTO JEWS .. in 1947 , the\nlight eyed fair crypto Jew Sikhs were the largest fertile land owners in Punjab\n, all land next to major canals <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HE WAS NOT A TRANSLATOR\nAS PER ROTSHCHILDs HISTORIANS PROPAGANDA \u2014 THE WHITE JEW COMPILED THIS BOOK\n--&nbsp; PACKED IT WITH FAKE DASA VERSES AND\nALSO VERSES OF TWO SUFI MUSLIMS . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THERE WAS NO SIKHISM\nTILL THE DEATH OF GURU GOBIND SINGH IN 1708 AD,&nbsp;\nBY WHICH TIME JEW ROTHSCHILD WAS CONTROLLING EVERYTHING IN INDIA .&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE NINE PREVIOUS GURUS DID NOT WEAR 5K<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ALL TEN GURUS&nbsp; MARRIED KHATRI HINDU WOMEN WITH HINDU WEDDING\nRITES&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NINE GURUS HAD\nCREMATIONS WITH HINDU CREMATION RITES.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE BODY OF TEN GURU\nGURU GOBIND SINGH WENT MISSING ALONG WITH HIS HORSE ( EQUATED WITH MOHAMMAD THE\nPROPHET WHOSE ALONG WITH HORSE ASCENDED TO HEAVEN FROM DOME OF THE ROCK\nJERUSALEM ) .</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">ROTHSCHILD CREATED ALL THESE BHAKTI BASED GODS-- LIKE SHIRDI SAI BABA, BASAVA , KANNAGI ,&nbsp; VITHOBA ETC --ALL THESE ARE VOTE BANKS&nbsp;</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Destiny is commonly\nregarded as fate by the shallow western mind - but both are as different as\nchalk and cheese..<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;
